05.name: PRINT SCREEN; CPU-generated (80186+) - BOUND RANGE EXCEEDED

AH.00:
VIDEO - SET VIDEO MODE
	AL = desired video mode (see #00010)
Return: AL = video mode flag (Phoenix, AMI BIOS)
	    20h mode > 7
	    30h modes 0-5 and 7
	    3Fh mode 6
	AL = CRT controller mode byte (Phoenix 386 BIOS v1.10)
AH.01:
VIDEO - SET TEXT-MODE CURSOR SHAPE
	CH = cursor start and options (see #00013)
	CL = bottom scan line containing cursor (bits 0-4)
Return: nothing
AH.02:
VIDEO - SET CURSOR POSITION
	BH = page number
	    0-3 in modes 2&3
	    0-7 in modes 0&1
	    0 in graphics modes
	DH = row (00h is top)
	DL = column (00h is left)
Return: nothing
AH.03:
VIDEO - GET CURSOR POSITION AND SIZE
	BH = page number
	    0-3 in modes 2&3
	    0-7 in modes 0&1
	    0 in graphics modes
Return: AX = 0000h (Phoenix BIOS)
	CH = start scan line
	CL = end scan line
	DH = row (00h is top)
	DL = column (00h is left)
AH.04:
HUNTER 16 - GET CURSOR ADDRESS
	BH = page
Return: DH = row (0..24)
	DL = column (0..79)
	CH = cursor pixel Y-address (0..199)
	CL = cursor pixel X-address (0..639)
AH.05:
VIDEO - PCjr, Tandy 1000 - SET CRT/CPU PAGE REGISTERS
	AL = subfunction
	    81h set CPU page register
		BL = CPU page
	    82h set CRT page register
		BH = CRT page
	    83h set both CPU and CRT page registers
		BL = CPU page
		BH = CRT page
Return: nothing
AH.06:
VIDEO - SCROLL UP WINDOW
	AL = number of lines by which to scroll up (00h = clear entire window)
	BH = attribute used to write blank lines at bottom of window
	CH,CL = row,column of window's upper left corner
	DH,DL = row,column of window's lower right corner
Return: nothing
AH.07:
VIDEO - SCROLL DOWN WINDOW
	AL = number of lines by which to scroll down (00h=clear entire window)
	BH = attribute used to write blank lines at top of window
	CH,CL = row,column of window's upper left corner
	DH,DL = row,column of window's lower right corner
Return: nothing
AH.08:
VIDEO - READ CHARACTER AND ATTRIBUTE AT CURSOR POSITION
	BH = page number (00h to number of pages - 1) (see #00010)
Return: AH = character's attribute (text mode only) (see #00014)
	AH = character's color (Tandy 2000 graphics mode only)
	AL = character
AH.09:
VIDEO - WRITE CHARACTER AND ATTRIBUTE AT CURSOR POSITION
	AL = character to display
	BH = page number (00h to number of pages - 1) (see #00010)
	    background color in 256-color graphics modes (ET4000)
	BL = attribute (text mode) or color (graphics mode)
	    if bit 7 set in <256-color graphics mode, character is XOR'ed
	      onto screen
	CX = number of times to write character
Return: nothing
AH.0A:
VIDEO - WRITE CHARACTER ONLY AT CURSOR POSITION
	AL = character to display
	BH = page number (00h to number of pages - 1) (see #00010)
	    background color in 256-color graphics modes (ET4000)
	BL = attribute (PCjr, Tandy 1000 only) or color (graphics mode)
	    if bit 7 set in <256-color graphics mode, character is XOR'ed
	      onto screen
	CX = number of times to write character
Return: nothing
AH.0B:
Tandy 2000 - VIDEO - SET PALETTE ENTRY
	BH = 02h
	BL = palette entry number
	AL = new color value for palette entry
Return: nothing
AH.0C:
VIDEO - WRITE GRAPHICS PIXEL
	BH = page number
	AL = pixel color
	    if bit 7 set, value is XOR'ed onto screen except in 256-color modes
	CX = column
	DX = row
Return: nothing
AH.0D:
VIDEO - READ GRAPHICS PIXEL
	BH = page number
	CX = column
	DX = row
Return: AL = pixel color
AH.0E:
VIDEO - TELETYPE OUTPUT
	AL = character to write
	BH = page number
	BL = foreground color (graphics modes only)
Return: nothing
AH.0F:
FRIEZE v7.41+ - INSTALLATION CHECK
	SI = F123h
	DI = 321Fh
Return: AH = number of character columns
	AL = display mode (see #00010 at AH=00h)
	BH = active page (see AH=05h)
	SI = DI = F345h if installed
AH.10:
Tandy 2000 - VIDEO - GET/SET CHARACTER FONTS
	AL = control value
	    bit 0: set character set instead of reading it
	    bit 1: high 128 characters instead of low 128 characters
	ES:BX -> new character set if AL bit 0 set
Return: ES:BX -> current character set if AL bit 0 clear on entry
AH.11:
VIDEO - Realtek RTVGA - TEXT-MODE CHARACTER GENERATOR FUNCTIONS
	AL = 07h load user-specified patterns and recalculate mode parms
		 parameters are the same as for AX=1110h
	AL = 08h load monochrome patterns (8x14) and recalculate mode parms
		 parameters are the same as for AX=1111h
	AL = 09h load ROM 8 by 8 double-dot patterns and recalculate mode parms
		 parameters are the same as for AX=1112h
	AL = 0Bh load ROM 8x16 character set (VGA) and recalculate mode parms
		 parameters are the same as for AX=1114h
AH.12:
Tseng ET-4000 BIOS - GET/SET SCREEN REFRESH RATE
	BL = F1h
	AL = subfunction
	    00h set refresh rate
	    01h get refresh rate
	BH = video mode
	    00h	 640x480
	    01h	 800x600
	    02h	 1024x768
	    03h	 1280x1024
	CX = new refresh rate (see #00035) if AL = 00h
Return: AL = 12h if supported
	    CX = current rate (for AL=00h, a changed CX indicates failure)
AH.13:
VIDEO - WRITE STRING (AT and later,EGA)
	AL = write mode
	   bit 0: update cursor after writing
	   bit 1: string contains alternating characters and attributes
	   bits 2-7: reserved (0)
	BH = page number
	BL = attribute if string contains only characters
	CX = number of characters in string
	DH,DL = row,column at which to start writing
	ES:BP -> string to write
Return: nothing
AH.15:
VIDEO - SET SUPERIMPOSE MODE (Sperry PC)
	AL = superimpose mode
	    00h show graphics screen
	    01h show text screen
	    02h show text screen superimposed on graphics screen
Return: nothing
AH.19:
Japanese VIDEO - DOUBLE-BYTE CHARACTER SET SHIFT INFORMATION
	???
Return: ???
AH.1B:
VIDEO - FUNCTIONALITY/STATE INFORMATION (PS,VGA/MCGA)
	BX = implementation type
	    0000h return funtionality/state information
	ES:DI -> 64-byte buffer for state information (see #00040)
Return: AL = 1Bh if function supported
	    ES:DI buffer filled with state information
AH.1C:
VIDEO - SAVE/RESTORE VIDEO STATE (PS50+,VGA)
	AL = function
	    00h return state buffer size
		Return: BX = number of 64-byte blocks needed
	    01h save video state
		ES:BX -> buffer
	    02h restore video state
		ES:BX -> buffer containing previously saved state
	CX = requested states (see #00048)
Return: AL = 1Ch if function supported
AH.1D: Tseng ET-4000 BIOS v3.00 and v8.00 - BUG
AH.40:
VIDEO - Hercules GRAFIX - "GMODE" - SET GRAPHICS MODE
Return: nothing
AH.41:
VIDEO - Hercules GRAFIX - "TMODE" - SET TEXT MODE
Return: nothing
AH.42:
VIDEO - Hercules GRAFIX - "CLRSCR" - CLEAR CURRENT PAGE
Return: nothing
AH.43:
VIDEO - Hercules GRAFIX - "GPAGE" - SELECT DRAWING PAGE
	AL = page number (0,1)
Return: nothing
AH.44:
VIDEO - Hercules GRAFIX - "LEVEL" - SELECT DRAWING FUNCTION
	AL = drawing function
	    00h clear pixels
	    01h set pixels
	    02h invert pixels
Return: nothing
AH.45:
VIDEO - Hercules GRAFIX - "DISP" - SELECT PAGE TO DISPLAY
	AL = page number (0,1)
Return: nothing
AH.46:
VIDEO - Hercules GRAFIX - "PLOT" - DRAW ONE PIXEL
	DI = x (0-719)
	BP = y (0-347)
Return: nothing
AH.47:
VIDEO - Hercules GRAFIX - "GETPT" - FIND PIXEL VALUE
	DI = x (0-719)
	BP = y (0-347)
Return: AL = 00h pixel clear
	AL = 01h pixel set
AH.48:
VIDEO - Hercules GRAFIX - "MOVE" - MOVE TO POINT
	DI = x (0-719)
	BP = y (0-347)
Return: nothing
AH.49:
VIDEO - Hercules GRAFIX - "DLINE" - DRAW TO POINT
	DI = x (0-719)
	BP = y (0-347)
Return: nothing
AH.4A:
VIDEO - Hercules GRAFIX - "BLKFIL" - BLOCK FILL
	DI = x coordinate of lower left corner
	BP = y coordinate of lower left corner
	BX = height in pixels
	CX = width in pixels
Return: nothing
AH.4B:
VIDEO - Hercules GRAFIX - "TEXT" - DISPLAY CHARACTER
	AL = character to display
	DI = x (0-719)
	BP = y (0-347)
Return: nothing
AH.4C:
VIDEO - Hercules GRAFIX - "ARC" - DRAW ARC
	AL = quadrant (1 = upper right, 2 = upper left, etc)
	DI = x coordinate of center
	BP = y coordinate of center
	BX = radius
Return: nothing
AH.4D:
VIDEO - Hercules GRAFIX - "CIRC" - DRAW CIRCLE
	DI = x of center
	BP = y of center
	BX = radius
Return: nothing
AH.4E:
VIDEO - Hercules GRAFIX - "FILL" - FILL AREA
	DI = x coordinate of an interior point
	BP = y coordinate of an interior point
Return: nothing
AH.60:
HUNTER 16 - SET GRAPHICS FONT
	AL = new font
	    bit 7    output characters in reverse video
	    bits 0-6 font number (see #00200 at AH=77h)
Return: BH = cell width
	BL = cell height
AH.61:
HUNTER 16 - MOVE CURSOR TO GRAPHICS CO-ORDINATES
	CX = column
	DX = row
Return: nothing
AH.62:
HUNTER 16 - GET CURSOR POSITION IN GRAPHICS CO-ORDINATES
Return: CX = column
	DX = row
AH.63:
HUNTER 16 - SET CONTRAST
	AL = contrast (0..127)
Return: nothing
AH.64:
HUNTER 16 - SET BACKLIGHT LEVEL
	AL = level (0..15)
Return: nothing
AH.66:
HUNTER 16 - SPLIT DISPLAY
	AL = control bits (see #00187)
	BH = top row of lower section of LCD (0..7)
	BL = top row of lower section of the virtual screen (0..24)
Return: nothing
AH.70:
HUNTER 16 - DRAW ELLIPSE/CIRCLE
	DS:BX -> control block (see #00192)
Return: nothing
AH.71:
HUNTER 16 - DRAW LINE/BOX
	DS:BX -> control block (see #00199)
Return: nothing
AH.72:
HUNTER 16 - SELECT TEXT-MODE INVERSE VIDEO MECHANISM
	AL = mechanism to use
	    00h do not use inverse video
	    01h emulate MDA. Display attribute 07h is normal video and 70h is
		inverse video.
	    02h use inverse video if background is non-black.
	    03h use inverse video for high intensity text.
	    04h use inverse video for text with background intensity greater
		than foreground intensity.
	    05h use inverse video for text with background color other than
		black or high intensity foreground.
Return: nothing
AH.73:
HUNTER 16 - SELECT TEXT FONT
	AL = new font
	      00h  7x7 in a 8x8 cell
	      01h  5x7 in a 6x8 cell
	      06h  3x5 in a 4x6 cell
Return: BH = cell width
	BL = cell height
AH.74:
HUNTER 16 - SET LCD WINDOWS POSITION
	DH = row (0..24)
	DL = column (0..79)
Return: nothing
AH.75:
HUNTER 16 - SET ZOOM
	AL = new Zoom state (00h off, nonzero on)
Return: nothing
AH.76:
HUNTER 16 - LOOKING KEYS
	AL = action
	     00h home the window
	     01h move up one line
	     02h move down one line
	     03h move left one character
	     04h move right one character
	     05h flip window to other side of virtual screen
Return: nothing
AH.77:
HUNTER 16 - GET GRAPHICS FONT
Return: AL = font number (see #00200)
AH.78:
HUNTER 16 - TURN BACKLIGHT ON/OFF
	AL = new state of backlight (00h on, 01h off)
Return: nothing
AH.7F:
Paradise SVGA - WD90C24 INSTALLATION CHECK
Return: AX = 1234h if WD90C24 chip installed
AH.96:
VHRBIOS.SYS - GET OTHER DISPLAY INFO
Return: AL = display type (see AH=1Ah)
	AH = ??? (possibly related to Micro Channel support)
AH.BB:
Doorway - SET BIOS/DIRECT REDIRECTION
	AL = new redirection mode
	    00h BIOS (hook and redirect INT 10h,etc.)
	    01h DIRECT (scan video memory for changes)
Return: ???
AH.BF:
Athena Digital HGCIBM.COM - INSTALLATION CHECK
	CX = 0000h (???)
Return: CX = 0202h
	DL = ??? (internal data, possibly version number)
AH.CD:
VIDEO - UltraVision - SET ULTRAVISION TEXT MODE (EGA,VGA)
	AL = text mode number (see #00220)
Return: AX = CDCDh if invalid mode
AH.D0:
VIDEO - HP 100LX/200LX - SET ZOOM MODE
	AL = zoom mode
	    02h 80x25 mono
	    03h 80x25 color
	    80h 64x18 mono
	    81h 64x18 color
	    82h 40x25 mono
	    83h 40x25 color
	    84h 40x16 mono
	    85h 40x16 color
Return: nothing
AH.EF:
VIDEO - MSHERC.COM - GET VIDEO ADAPTER TYPE AND MODE
Return: DL = video adapter type
	    00h original Hercules
	    01h Hercules Plus	 (port 03BAh reads x001xxxxx)
	    02h Hercules InColor (port 03BAh reads x101xxxxx)
	    FFh not a Hercules-compatible card (port 03BAh bit 7 not pulsing)
	DH = memory mode byte
	    00h "half" mode
	    01h "full" mode
	    FFh not a Hercules-compatible card
AH.F1:
VHRBIOS.SYS - SET REVERSE VIDEO
	AL = new video state 
	    (bit 5 set for black text on white, clear for white on black)
Return: ???
AH.F3:
VHRBIOS.SYS - SWITCH BETWEEN DUAL MONITORS???
Return: ???
AH.F4:
VHRBIOS.SYS - GET VERSION
Return: AX = driver version (AH = major, AL = minor)
AH.F5:
VHRBIOS.SYS - GET VENDOR ID
Return: AXBX = vendor ID (4D44h:5349h = 'MDSI' for Micro Display Systems Inc.)
AH.F6:
VHRBIOS.SYS - GET INFO
	AL = what to get
	    00h device driver state
		Return: AX = device driver state
	    01h video mode info
		Return: AL = video mode
			DH = screen height in rows
			DL = screen width in columns
AH.F7:
EGA Register Interface Library - DEFINE DEFAULT REGISTER TABLE
	DX = port number
	   Pointer/data chips
	      00h CRTC (3B4h mono modes, 3D4h color modes)
	      08h Sequencer 3C4h
	      10h Graphics Controller 3CEh
	      18h Attribute Controller 3C0h
	   Single registers
	      20h Miscellaneous Output register 3C2h
	      28h Feature Control register (3BAh mono modes, 3DAh color modes)
	      30h Graphics 1 Position register 3CCh
	      38h Graphics 2 Position register 3CAh
	ES:BX -> table of one-byte entries, one byte to be written to each
		 register
Return: nothing
AH.FA:
EGA Register Interface Library - INTERROGATE DRIVER
	BX = 0000h
Return: BX = 0000h if RIL driver not present
	ES:BX -> EGA Register Interface version number, if present:
	    byte 0 = major release number
	    byte 1 = minor release number
AH.FE:
TopView - GET SHADOW BUFFER
	ES:DI -> assumed video buffer
		B800h:0000h color text/CGA graphics, B000h:0000h mono text,
		  or A000h:0000h EGA/VGA graphics (RSIS environments only)
Return: ES:DI -> actual video buffer for calling process
AH.FF:
VIDEO - Oak VGA BIOS v1.02+ - SET EMULATION
	AL = emulation
	    43h ('C') CGA emulation
	    45h ('E') EGA emulation
	    4Dh ('M') Hercules emulation
	    56h ('V') VGA emulation
	ES:DI -> signature string "Calamity"
Return: VGA switched to suggested mode

AX.0070:
VIDEO - Everex Micro Enhancer EGA/Viewpoint VGA - EXTENDED MODE SET
	BL = mode (see #00011)
AX.007E:
VIDEO - Paradise VGA, AT&T VDC600 - SET SPECIAL MODE
	BX = horizontal dimension of the mode desired
	CX = vertical dimension of the mode desired
	    (both BX/CX in pixels for graphics modes, rows for alpha modes)
	DX = number of colors of the mode desired (0000h for monochrome modes)
Return: BH = 7Eh if successful (Paradise VGA)
	AL = 7Eh if successful (AT&T VDC600)
AX.007F:
Paradise VGA - ???
	BH = A6h
	???
Return: BH = status (00h failed or not supported, 7Fh successful)
	???
AX.0500:
VIDEO - Corona/Cordata BIOS v4.10+ - SET GRAPHICS BITMAP BUFFER
	BX = segment of buffer
Return: nothing
AX.050F:
VIDEO - Corona/Cordata BIOS v4.10+ - GET GRAPHICS BITMAP BUFFER
Return: DX = segment of graphics bitmap buffer
AX.0580:
VIDEO - PCjr, Tandy 1000 - GET CRT/CPU PAGE REGISTERS
Return: BH = CRT page register
	BL = CPU page register
AX.0F56:
VUIMAGE DISPLAY DRIVER (v2.20 and below)
	BX = 4756h
	CX = 4944h
	DL = function
	    01h installation check
		Return: AX = 5649h
			BX = 4443h
			CX = 5647h
			DH = 01h
	    02h get first video mode's parameters
		Return: AX = BIOS mode number
			BX = width in pixels
			CX = height in pixels
			DX = number of colors
	    03h get next video mode's parameters
		Return: as for DL=02h
	    04h display line???
		ES:DI -> record (see #00016)
		???
		Return: ???
AX.1000:
VIDEO - SET SINGLE PALETTE REGISTER (PCjr,Tandy,EGA,MCGA,VGA)
	BL = palette register number (00h-0Fh)
	   = attribute register number (undocumented) (see #00017)
	BH = color or attribute register value
Return: nothing
AX.1001:
VIDEO - SET BORDER (OVERSCAN) COLOR (PCjr,Tandy,EGA,VGA)
	BH = border color (00h-3Fh)
Return: nothing
AX.1002:
VIDEO - SET ALL PALETTE REGISTERS (PCjr,Tandy,EGA,VGA)
	ES:DX -> palette register list (see #00018)
	BH = 00h to avoid problems on some adapters
Return: nothing
AX.1003:
VIDEO - TOGGLE INTENSITY/BLINKING BIT (Jr, PS, TANDY 1000, EGA, VGA)
	BL = new state
	    00h background intensity enabled
	    01h blink enabled
	BH = 00h to avoid problems on some adapters
Return: nothing
AX.1007:
VIDEO - GET INDIVIDUAL PALETTE REGISTER (VGA,UltraVision v2+)
	BL = palette or attribute (undoc) register number (see #00017)
Return: BH = palette or attribute register value
AX.1008:
VIDEO - READ OVERSCAN (BORDER COLOR) REGISTER (VGA,UltraVision v2+)
Return: BH = border color (00h-3Fh)
AX.1009:
VIDEO - READ ALL PALETTE REGISTERS AND OVERSCAN REGISTER (VGA)
	ES:DX -> 17-byte buffer for palette register list (see #00018)
Return: nothing
AX.1010:
VIDEO - SET INDIVIDUAL DAC REGISTER (VGA/MCGA)
	BX = register number
	CH = new value for green (0-63)
	CL = new value for blue (0-63)
	DH = new value for red (0-63)
Return: nothing
AX.1012:
VIDEO - SET BLOCK OF DAC REGISTERS (VGA/MCGA)
	BX = starting color register
	CX = number of registers to set
	ES:DX -> table of 3*CX bytes where each 3 byte group represents one
		 byte each of red, green and blue (0-63)
Return: nothing
AX.1013:
VIDEO - SELECT VIDEO DAC COLOR PAGE (VGA)
	BL = subfunction
	    00h select paging mode
		BH = 00h select 4 blocks of 64
		BH = 01h select 16 blocks of 16
	    01h select page
		BH = page number (00h to 03h) or (00h to 0Fh)
Return: nothing
AX.1015:
VIDEO - READ INDIVIDUAL DAC REGISTER (VGA/MCGA)
	BL = palette register number
Return: DH = red value
	CH = green value
	CL = blue value
	AX destroyed by some BIOSes
	      (e.g. Tseng ET4000 BIOS v8.00n always returns AX=00C9h)
AX.1017:
VIDEO - READ BLOCK OF DAC REGISTERS (VGA/MCGA)
	BX = starting palette register
	CX = number of palette registers to read
	ES:DX -> buffer (3 * CX bytes in size) (see also AX=1012h)
Return: buffer filled with CX red, green and blue triples
AX.1018:
VIDEO - SET PEL MASK (VGA/MCGA)
	BL = new PEL value
Return: nothing
AX.1019:
VIDEO - READ PEL MASK (VGA/MCGA)
Return: BL = value read
AX.101A:
VIDEO - GET VIDEO DAC COLOR-PAGE STATE (VGA)
Return: BL = paging mode
	    00h four pages of 64
	    01h sixteen pages of 16
	BH = current page
AX.101B:
VIDEO - PERFORM GRAY-SCALE SUMMING (VGA/MCGA)
	BX = starting palette register
	CX = number of registers to convert
Return: nothing
AX.10E0:
VIDEO - Diamond Speedstar 24 - SET 24-BIT GRAPHICS MODE
	BL = video mode (see also #00010 at AH=00h)
	    2Eh = 640x480
Return: ???
AX.10F0:
VIDEO - Tseng ET-4000 BIOS - SET HiColor GRAPHICS MODE
	BL = video mode (see also #00010 at AH=00h)
	    13h = 320x200x32K
	    2Dh = 640x350x32K
	    2Eh = 640x480x32K
	    2Fh = 640x400x32K
	    30h = 800x600x32K
	    3Eh = 640x480x16M (Genoa 7900)
	    FFh Tseng 24-bit color mode
		BH = mode
		    2Dh = 640x480
		    2Eh = 640x480x16M
		    2Fh = 640x400
		    30h = 800x600
		    38h = 1024x768??? (Tseng ET4000/W32i)
Return: AL = 10h if supported
	AH = status
	    00h if successful
	    other on error
AX.10F1:
VIDEO - Tseng ET-4000 BIOS - GET DAC TYPE
Return: AL = 10h if supported
	BL = type of digital/analog converter (see #00019)
AX.10F2:
VIDEO - Tseng ET-4000 BIOS - CHECK IF HiColor MODE/SET HiColor MODE
	BL = function
	    00h get current HiColor mode
	    01h set 15-bit HiColor mode
	    02h set 16-bit HiColor mode
Return: AX = 0010h if supported
	    BL = video mode type
		00h not in HiColor mode
		01h 15-bit RGB mode
		02h 16-bit RGB mode
		03h 24-bit RGB mode
AX.1100:
VIDEO - TEXT-MODE CHARGEN - LOAD USER-SPECIFIED PATTERNS (PS,EGA,VGA)
	ES:BP -> user table
	CX = count of patterns to store
	DX = character offset into map 2 block
	BL = block to load in map 2
	BH = number of bytes per character pattern
Return: nothing
AX.1101:
VIDEO - TEXT-MODE CHARGEN - LOAD ROM MONOCHROME PATTERNS (PS,EGA,VGA)
	BL = block to load
Return: nothing
AX.1102:
VIDEO - TEXT-MODE CHARGEN - LOAD ROM 8x8 DBL-DOT PATTERNS (PS,EGA,VGA)
	BL = block to load
Return: nothing
AX.1103:
VIDEO - TEXT-MODE CHARGEN - SET BLOCK SPECIFIER (PS,EGA,VGA)
	BL = block specifier (see #00020)
Return: nothing
AX.1104:
VIDEO - TEXT-MODE CHARGEN - LOAD ROM 8x16 CHARACTER SET (VGA)
	BL = block to load
Return: nothing
AX.110F:
VIDEO - Realtek RTVGA - SET USER 8x8 GRAPHICS CHARACTERS
	ES:BP -> user table for INT 1F
Return: nothing
AX.1110:
VIDEO - Realtek RTVGA - SET USER GRAPHICS CHARACTERS
	ES:BP -> user table
	CX = bytes per character
	BL = row specifier
	    00h user set
		DL = number of rows
	    01h 14 rows
	    02h 25 rows
	    03h 43 rows
Return: nothing
AX.1111:
VIDEO - Realtek RTVGA - SET ROM 8x14 GRAPHICS CHARACTERS
	BL = row specifier (see AX=1121h)
Return: nothing
AX.1112:
VIDEO - Realtek RTVGA - SET ROM 8x8 DOUBLE-DOT CHARACTERS
	BL = row specifier (see AX=1121h)
Return: nothing
AX.1114:
VIDEO - TEXT-MODE CHARGEN - LOAD ROM 8x16 CHARACTER SET (VGA)
	BL = block to load
Return: nothing
AX.1120:
VIDEO - GRAPH-MODE CHARGEN - SET USER 8x8 GRAPHICS CHARS (PS,EGA,VGA)
	ES:BP -> user table for INT 1F
Return: nothing
AX.1121:
VIDEO - GRAPH-MODE CHARGEN - SET USER GRAPHICS CHARACTERS (PS,EGA,VGA)
	ES:BP -> user table
	CX = bytes per character
	BL = row specifier
	    00h user set
		DL = number of rows
	    01h 14 rows
	    02h 25 rows
	    03h 43 rows
Return: AL = new number of rows (Diamond Stealth64 Video)

VIDEO - GRAPH-MODE CHARGEN - SET ROM 8x14 GRAPHICS CHARS (PS,EGA,VGA)
	BL = row specifier (see AX=1121h)
Return: nothing
AX.1123:
VIDEO - GRAPH-MODE CHARGEN - SET ROM 8x8 DOUBLE-DOT CHARS (PS,EGA,VGA)
	BL = row specifier (see AX=1121h)
Return: nothing
AX.1124:
VIDEO - GRAPH-MODE CHARGEN - LOAD 8x16 GRAPHICS CHARS (VGA,MCGA)
	BL = row specifier (see AX=1121h)
Return: nothing
AX.1129:
VIDEO - GRAPH-MODE CHARGEN - SET USER GRAPHICS CHARACTERS (Diamond)
	DI:BP -> user table
	CX = bytes per character
	BL = row specifier
	    00h user set
		DL = number of rows
	    01h 14 rows
	    02h 25 rows
	    03h 43 rows
Return: AL = new number of rows
AX.1130:
M10_SCR.COM v3.5+ - INSTALLATION CHECK
	BX = 4D4Fh
Return: CX = 4F4Dh if installed
	    ES:BP -> M10_SCR INT 10 handler

VIDEO - LOAD USER-SPECIFIED LCD CHARACTER FONT (CONV,Compaq Port 386)
	ES:DI -> character font

	    08h or 10h (Compaq)

	     01h load alternate font (block 1)
	CX = number of characters to store
	DX = character offset into RAM font area
Return: nothing
AX.1401:
VIDEO - LOAD SYSTEM ROM DEFAULT LCD CHARACTER FONT (CONV,CP386)
	BL = font to load
	    00h main font (block 0)
	    01h alternate font (block 1)
Return: nothing
AX.1402:
VIDEO - SET MAPPING OF LCD HIGH INTENSITY ATTRIBUTES (CONV,CP386)
	BL = subfunction
	    00h ignore high intensity attribute
	    01h map high intensity to reverse video
	    02h map high intensity to underscore
	    03h map high intensity to selected alternate font
	    B0h half intensity (Compaq)
	    B1h toggle active intensity bit interpretation (CP386)
Return: nothing
AX.1A00:
VIDEO - GET DISPLAY COMBINATION CODE (PS,VGA/MCGA)
Return: AL = 1Ah if function was supported
	    BL = active display code (see #00039)
	    BH = alternate display code (see #00039)

VIDEO - SET DISPLAY COMBINATION CODE (PS,VGA/MCGA)
	BL = active display code (see #00039)
	BH = alternate display code
Return: AL = 1Ah if function was supported

Diamond Stealth64 Video - INSTALLATION CHECK
	BX = FDECh
Return: BX = CDEFh if Diamond Stealth64 Video 2001-series video card installed
	    AL = number of megabytes of video memory
	    AH = card type??? (4Bh for VL-Bus/5Bh for PCI)
	    CX = ??? (0000h)

AX.1E00:
VIDEO - FLAT-PANEL - READ INFORMATION
Return: AL = 1Eh if function supported
	    BL = flat-panel status (see #00052)
	    ES:DI -> information table (see #00053)
AX.1E01:
VIDEO - FLAT-PANEL - LCD/CRT DISPLAY CONTROL
	BH = function
	    bit 7: =1 set display control, =0 query control
	    bits 6-0: reserved (0)
	---if BH bit 7 set---
	BL = new display combination (see #00054)
Return: AL = 1Eh if function supported
	    BH = results
		bit 7: query/set (copied from input)
		bits 6-3: reserved (0)
		bit 2: simultaneous display is supported by hardware
		bit 1: LCD/CRT display control supported by hardware
		bit 0: set operation was successful (always clear on get)
	    BL = active display combination (see #00054)
AX.1E02:
VIDEO - FLAT-PANEL - DISPLAY POSITION
	BH = function
	    bit 7: =1 set display position, =0 query position
	    bits 6-0: reserved (0)
	---if BH bit 7 set---
	BL = new position setting (see #00055)
Return: AL = 1Eh if function supported
	    BH = results
		bit 7: query/set (copied from input)
		bits 6-4: reserved (0)
		bit 3: positioning to top is supported by hardware
		bit 2: positioning to center is supported by hardware
		bit 1: positioning to bottom is supported by hardware
		bit 0: set operation was successful (always clear on get)
	    BL = active position setting (see #00055)
AX.1E03:
VIDEO - FLAT-PANEL - VERTICAL EXPANSION FOR TEXT/GRAPHICS MODES
	BH = function
	    bit 7: =1 set vertical expansion, =0 query expansion
	    bits 6-0: reserved (0)
	---if BH bit 7 set---
	BL = new vertical expansion setting (see #00056)
Return: AL = 1Eh if function supported
	    BH = results
		bit 7: query/set (copied from input)
		bits 6-4: reserved (0)
		bit 3: vertical expansion of text is supported by hardware
		bit 2: vertical expansion of graphics is supported by hardware
		bit 1: hardware supports independent control of expansion in
			text and graphics modes
		bit 0: set operation was successful (always clear on get)
	    BL = active vertical expansion setting (see #00056)
AX.1E04:
VIDEO - FLAT-PANEL - NORMAL/REVERSE VIDEO FOR TEXT/GRAPHICS MODES
	BH = function
	    bit 7: =1 set normal/reverse video, =0 query normal/reverse
	    bits 6-0: reserved (0)
	---if BH bit 7 set---
	BL = new normal/reverse video setting (see #00057)
Return: AL = 1Eh if function supported
	    BH = results
		bit 7: query/set (copied from input)
		bits 6-4: reserved (0)
		bit 3: hardware supports reverse video for text modes
		bit 2: hardware supports reverse video for graphics modes
		bit 1: hardware supports independent control of reverse video
		      in text and graphics modes
		bit 0: set operation was successful (always clear on get)
	    BL = active normal/reverse video setting (see #00057)
AX.1E05:
VIDEO - FLAT-PANEL - BRIGHTNESS CONTROL
	BH = function
	    bit 7: =1 set brightness, =0 query brightness
	    bits 6-0: reserved (0)
	---if BH bit 7 set---
	BL = new brightness setting (see #00058)
Return: AL = 1Eh if function supported
	    BH = results
		bit 7: query/set (copied from input)
		bits 6-2: reserved (0)
		bit 1: software brightness control is supported
		bit 0: set operation was successful (always clear on get)
	    BL = active brightness setting (see #00058)
AX.1E06:
VIDEO - FLAT-PANEL - CONTRAST CONTROL FOR TEXT/GRAPHICS
	BH = function
	    bit 7: =1 set contrast control, =0 query contrast
	    bits 6-0: reserved (0)
	---if BH bit 7 set---
	BL = new normal/reverse video setting (see #00059)
Return: AL = 1Eh if function supported
	    BH = results
		bit 7: query/set (copied from input)
		bits 6-4: reserved (0)
		bit 3: software contrast control supported for text
		bit 2: software contrast control supported for graphics
		bit 1: hardware supports independent control of contrast
		      in text and graphics modes
		bit 0: set operation was successful (always clear on get)
	    BL = active contrast setting (see #00059)
AX.1E07:
VIDEO - FLAT-PANEL - BRIGHTNESS SETTING
	BH = function
	    bit 7: =1 set brightness control, =0 query brightness
	    bit 6: use standard brightness
	    bits 5-0: reserved (0)
	---if BH bits 7,6=10---
	BL = brightness (00h = minimum, FFh = maximum)
Return: AL = 1Eh if function supported
	    BH = results
		bit 7: query/set (copied from input)
		bit 6: standard/custom (copied from input)
		bits 5-2: reserved (0)
		bit 1: software brightness control is supported
		bit 0: set operation was succesful (always clear on get)
	    BL = brightness (00h = minimum, FFh = maximum)
AX.1E08:
VIDEO - FLAT-PANEL - CONTRAST SETTING
	BH = function
	    bit 7: =1 set contrast control, =0 query contrast
	    bit 6: use standard contrast
	    bits 5-0: reserved (0)
	---if BH bits 7,6=10---
	BL = contrast (00h = minimum, FFh = maximum)
Return: AL = 1Eh if function supported
	    BH = results
		bit 7: query/set (copied from input)
		bit 6: standard/custom (copied from input)
		bits 5-2: reserved (0)
		bit 1: software contrast control is supported
		bit 0: set operation was succesful (always clear on get)
	    BL = contrast (00h = minimum, FFh = maximum)

	    03h non-automatic centering

	    AH = status
		00h unsuccessful
		01h successful
		    ES:BX buffer filled

Chips & Technologies Wingine DGX - RESTORE VIDEO STATE
	CX = state(s) to be restored (see #00186)
	ES:BX -> buffer containing previously-saved state information
Return: AL = 5Fh if function supported
	    AH = status
		00h unsuccessful
		01h successful

Return: AL <> 7Fh if not supported

	BH = foreground color for bright text (FFh = current)
Return: CL = hardware underline status

VIDEO - UltraVision v1.2+ - GET UNDERLINE STATUS (EGA,VGA)
Return: CL = hardware underline status (see #00221)
	BL = foreground color for normal text
	BH = foreground color for bright text

VIDEO - UltraVision - GET POINTER TO ??? (EGA,VGA)
Return: DS:DI -> pointer to ???

	BH = bytes per character (08h,0Ah,0Bh,0Eh,13h,14h)
	CX = ABCDh load 9xN alternate font (v2+)
	   else number of characters to load

Return: AX = FFFFh if invalid font parameters

S3VBE/Core2.0 v3.00+ - INSTALLATION CHECK
Return: AX = FFFFh if installed
	    BX = resident code segment
	    DX = version (binary, DH = major, DL = minor)

S3VBE/Core2.0 v3.00+ - GET ACTIVE OPTIONS
Return: AX = FFFFh if supported
	    BX = currently active options (see #00222)

S3VBE/Core2.0 v3.00+ - SET ACTIVE OPTIONS
	BX = new active options (see #00222)
Return: AX = FFFFh if supported

S3VBE/Core2.0 v3.10+ - GET VBE/Core CAPABILITIES
Return: AX = FFFFh if supported
	    BX = capabilities
