			A0000h for VBE functions 04h/05h
AX.D004:
S3VBE/Core2.0 v3.10+ - ACTIVATE SPEED-UP
Return: AX = FFFFh if supported
	BX = status
	    0000h SpeedUp activated
	    0001h SpeedUp not possible (wrong memory organization for mode)
	    0002h SpeedUp not possible (linear frame buffer active)
AX.D005:
S3VBE/Core2.0 v3.10+ - DEACTIVATE SPEED-UP
Return: AX = FFFFh if supported
	BX = status
	    0000h SpeedUp deactivated
	    0001h SpeedUp not possible (wrong memory organization for mode)
	    0002h SpeedUp not possible (linear frame buffer active)
AX.DFA5:
VIDEO - Compaq ADAPT.COM - GET ??? DATA AREA
Return: AX = BDBFh if supported
	    ES:DI -> ??? data area
	    BX = ES

AX.0225:
Blank-It Screen Blanker - SET HOTKEY FOR MANUAL BLANKING
	BX = 6909h
	CL = key scan code (see #00229)
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
	    AL = error code
AX.FFFE:
BACK&FORTH (before v1.62) API
	CX = FFFEh
	BX = function
	    00h installation check
		Return: AX = installation state
			    0001h BNFHIGH and BNFLOW both loaded
			    0003h only BNFHIGH loaded
			    else neither loaded
	    01h ???
		Return: DX:AX -> ???
	    02h ???
	    03h ???
	    04h ???
	    05h ??? switches current PSP segment and stack if BNFLOW has not
		    yet announced itself installed
	    06h ???
		Return: AX = ???

AH.BC:
BNU FOSSIL - INSTALLATION CHECK
	DX = 1954h
Return: AX = 1954h
	ES:DX -> entry point of driver (instead of INT 14)

AX.FFFE:
Back&Forth v1.62+ - API
	CX = FFFEh
	BX = function
	    00h installation check
		Return: AX = 0001h installed
			     else  not loaded
	    01h (reserved)
	    02h build program ID list (shareware Back&Forth)
		ES:DI -> buffer of at least 100 bytes, to be filled with words
		Return: AX = number of programs defined
			ES:DI buffer filled with AX words
	    02h get memory statistics (Back&Forth Professional)
		Return: AX = available swap memory, KBytes
			BX = maximum task size, KBytes
			DX = fixed overhead per task, excluding video/macro
			      storage
	    03h switch to specified task (task need not be open yet)
		DX = two-letter program ID
		Return: AX = status
			    0000h if task undefined
			    0001h task switch will occur when safe
	    04h (reserved)
	    05h (reserved)
	    06h get version (documented only for Back&Forth Professional)
		Return: AX = version * 100 (v1.71 = 00ABh)
	    07h spawn program (Back&Forth Professional only???)
		ES:DI -> BF_SPAWN record (see #00232)
		Return: AX = status
			    0000h if no task handles free
			    0001h spawn will occur when safe
	    08h get open tasks (documented only for Back&Forth Professional)
		ES:DI -> task info buffer (see #00231,#00233)
		Return: AX = number of open tasks (max 20)
		Note:	the supplied buffer must be large enough to hold 21
			  task entries
	    09h (reserved)
	    ---Back&Forth Professional---
	    0Ah get active clipboard filename
		Return: DX:AX -> ASCIZ clipboard filename
	    0Bh get active task number
		AX = active task number (00h-13h)
		BX = number of tasks allocated
		DX = maximum number of tasks
	    0Ch (reserved)
	    0Dh (reserved)
	    0Eh (reserved)
	    0Fh stuff string into keyboard buffer
		ES:DI -> ASCIZ string to be stuffed
		Return: nothing
	    10h check if in graphics mode
		Return: AX = state
			    0000h color text mode
			    0004h mono text mode
			    FFFFh graphics mode
	    11h get Back&Forth Professional user number
		Return: AX = user number (0000h-00FFh)
	    12h switch task by task number
		DX = task number
		Return: AX = status
			    0000h attempted to switch to active task
			    0001h task switch will occur when safe
			    FFFFh invalid task number
	    13h delete (kill) task
		DX = task number
		Return: AX = status
			    0000h attempted to delete the active task
			    0001h successfully deleted
			    FFFFh invalid task number
		Note:	the active task number will change if the deleted task
			  was lower in the task list than the active task
	    14h get next available task handle
		Return:	AX = next available task handle
			    FFFFh if task table is full

AH.00:
DISK - RESET DISK SYSTEM
	DL = drive (if bit 7 is set both hard disks and floppy disks reset)
Return: AH = status (see #00234)
	CF clear if successful (returned AH=00h)
	CF set on error
AH.01:
DISK - GET STATUS OF LAST OPERATION
	DL = drive (bit 7 set for hard disk)
Return: CF clear if successful (returned status 00h)
	CF set on error
	AH = status of previous operation (see #00234)
AH.02:
DISK - READ SECTOR(S) INTO MEMORY
	AL = number of sectors to read (must be nonzero)
	CH = low eight bits of cylinder number
	CL = sector number 1-63 (bits 0-5)
	     high two bits of cylinder (bits 6-7, hard disk only)
	DH = head number
	DL = drive number (bit 7 set for hard disk)
	ES:BX -> data buffer
Return: CF set on error
	    if AH = 11h (corrected ECC error), AL = burst length
	CF clear if successful
	AH = status (see #00234)
	AL = number of sectors transferred (only valid if CF set for some
	      BIOSes)
AH.03:
DISK - WRITE DISK SECTOR(S)
	AL = number of sectors to write (must be nonzero)
	CH = low eight bits of cylinder number
	CL = sector number 1-63 (bits 0-5)
	     high two bits of cylinder (bits 6-7, hard disk only)
	DH = head number
	DL = drive number (bit 7 set for hard disk)
	ES:BX -> data buffer
Return: CF set on error
	CF clear if successful
	AH = status (see #00234)
	AL = number of sectors transferred
	      (only valid if CF set for some BIOSes)
AH.04:
DISK - VERIFY DISK SECTOR(S)
	AL = number of sectors to verify (must be nonzero)
	CH = low eight bits of cylinder number
	CL = sector number 1-63 (bits 0-5)
	     high two bits of cylinder (bits 6-7, hard disk only)
	DH = head number
	DL = drive number (bit 7 set for hard disk)
	ES:BX -> data buffer (PC,XT,AT with BIOS prior to 1985/11/15)
Return: CF set on error
	CF clear if successful
	AH = status (see #00234)
	AL = number of sectors verified
AH.05:
FIXED DISK - FORMAT TRACK
	AL = interleave value (XT-type controllers only)
	ES:BX -> 512-byte format buffer
		the first 2*(sectors/track) bytes contain F,N for each sector
		   F = sector type
			00h for good sector
			20h to unassign from alternate location
			40h to assign to alternate location
			80h for bad sector
		   N = sector number
	CH = cylinder number (bits 8,9 in high bits of CL)
	CL = high bits of cylinder number (bits 7,6)
	DH = head
	DL = drive
Return: CF set on error
	CF clear if successful
	AH = status code (see #00234)
AH.06:
FIXED DISK - FORMAT TRACK AND SET BAD SECTOR FLAGS (XT,PORT)
	AL = interleave value
	CH = cylinder number (bits 8,9 in high bits of CL)
	CL = sector number
	DH = head
	DL = drive
Return: AH = status code (see #00234)
AH.07:
FIXED DISK - FORMAT DRIVE STARTING AT GIVEN TRACK (XT,PORT)
	AL = interleave value (XT only)
	ES:BX = 512-byte format buffer (see AH=05h)
	CH = cylinder number (bits 8,9 in high bits of CL)
	CL = sector number
	DH = head
	DL = drive
Return: AH = status code (see #00234)
AH.08:
DISK - GET DRIVE PARAMETERS (PC,XT286,CONV,PS,ESDI,SCSI)
	DL = drive (bit 7 set for hard disk)
	ES:DI = 0000h:0000h to guard against BIOS bugs
Return: CF set on error
	    AH = status (07h) (see #00234)
	CF clear if successful
	    AH = 00h
	    AL = 00h on at least some BIOSes
	    BL = drive type (AT/PS2 floppies only) (see #00242)
	    CH = low eight bits of maximum cylinder number
	    CL = maximum sector number (bits 5-0)
		 high two bits of maximum cylinder number (bits 7-6)
	    DH = maximum head number
	    DL = number of drives
	    ES:DI -> drive parameter table (floppies only)
AH.09:
HARD DISK - INITIALIZE CONTROLLER WITH DRIVE PARAMETERS (AT,PS)
	DL = drive (80h for first, 81h for second)
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
	AH = status (see #00234)
AH.0A:
HARD DISK - READ LONG SECTOR(S) (AT and later)
	AL = number of sectors (01h may be only value supported)
	CH = low eight bits of cylinder number
	CL = sector number (bits 5-0)
	     high two bits of cylinder number (bits 7-6)
	DH = head number
	DL = drive number (80h = first, 81h = second)
	ES:BX -> data buffer
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
	AH = status (see #00234)
	AL = number of sectors transferred
AH.0B:
HARD DISK - WRITE LONG SECTOR(S) (AT and later)
	AL = number of sectors (01h may be only value supported)
	CH = low eight bits of cylinder number
	CL = sector number (bits 5-0)
	     high two bits of cylinder number (bits 7-6)
	DH = head number
	DL = drive number (80h = first, 81h = second)
	ES:BX -> data buffer
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
	AH = status (see #00234)
	AL = number of sectors transferred
AH.0C:
HARD DISK - SEEK TO CYLINDER
	CH = low eight bits of cylinder number
	CL = sector number (bits 5-0)
	    high two bits of cylinder number (bits 7-6)
	DH = head number
	DL = drive number (80h = first, 81h = second hard disk)
Return: CF set on error
	CF clear if successful
	AH = status (see #00234)
AH.0D:
HARD DISK - RESET HARD DISKS
	DL = drive number (80h = first, 81h = second hard disk)
Return: CF set on error
	CF clear if successful
	AH = status (see #00234)
AH.0E:
HARD DISK - READ SECTOR BUFFER (XT only)
	DL = drive number (80h = first, 81h = second hard disk)
	ES:BX -> buffer
Return: CF set on error
	CF clear if successful
	AH = status code (see #00234)
AH.0F:
HARD DISK - WRITE SECTOR BUFFER (XT only)
	DL = drive number (80h = first, 81h = second hard disk)
	ES:BX -> buffer
Return: CF set on error
	CF clear if successful
	AH = status code (see #00234)
AH.10:
HARD DISK - CHECK IF DRIVE READY
	DL = drive number (80h = first, 81h = second hard disk)
Return: CF set on error
	CF clear if successful
	AH = status (see #00234 at AH=01h)
AH.11:
HARD DISK - RECALIBRATE DRIVE
	DL = drive number (80h = first, 81h = second hard disk)
Return: CF set on error
	CF clear if successful
	AH = status (see #00234 at AH=01h)
AH.12:
HARD DISK - CONTROLLER RAM DIAGNOSTIC (XT,PS)
	DL = drive number (80h = first, 81h = second hard disk)
Return: CF set on error
	CF clear if successful
	AH = status code (see #00234 at AH=01h)
	AL = 00h
AH.13:
HARD DISK - DRIVE DIAGNOSTIC (XT,PS)
	DL = drive number (80h = first, 81h = second hard disk)
Return: CF set on error
	CF clear if successful
	AH = status code (see #00234 at AH=01h)
	AL = 00h
AH.14:
HARD DISK - CONTROLLER INTERNAL DIAGNOSTIC
Return: CF set on error
	CF clear if successful
	AH = status code (see #00234 at AH=01h)
	AL = 00h
AH.15:
DISK - GET DISK TYPE (XT 1986/1/10 or later,XT286,AT,PS)
	DL = drive number (bit 7 set for hard disk)
	(AL = FFh, CX = FFFFh, see Note)
Return: CF clear if successful
	    AH = type code
		00h no such drive
		    (SpeedStor) AL = 03h hard disk
				    CX:DX = number of 512-byte sectors
		01h floppy without change-line support
		02h floppy (or other removable drive) with change-line support
		03h hard disk
		    CX:DX = number of 512-byte sectors
	CF set on error
	    AH = status (see #00234 at AH=01h)
AH.16:
FLOPPY DISK - DETECT DISK CHANGE (XT 1986/1/10 or later,XT286,AT,PS)
	DL = drive number (00h-7Fh)
	SI = 0000h (to avoid crash on AT&T 6300)
Return: CF clear if change line inactive
	    AH = 00h (disk not changed)
	CF set if change line active
	    AH = status
		01h invalid command (SyQuest)
		06h change line active or not supported
		80h drive not ready or not present
AH.17:
FLOPPY DISK - SET DISK TYPE FOR FORMAT (AT,PS)
	AL = format type
	    01h = 320/360K disk in 360K drive
	    02h = 320/360K disk in 1.2M drive
	    03h = 1.2M disk in 1.2M drive
	    04h = 720K disk in 720K or 1.44M drive
	DL = drive number
Return: CF set on error
	CF clear if successful
	AH = status (see #00234 at AH=01h)
AH.18:
DISK - SET MEDIA TYPE FOR FORMAT (AT model 3x9,XT2,XT286,PS)
	DL = drive number
	CH = lower 8 bits of highest cylinder number (number of cylinders - 1)
	CL = sectors per track (bits 0-5)
	     top 2 bits of highest cylinder number (bits 6,7)
Return: AH = status
	    00h requested combination supported
	    01h function not available
	    0Ch not supported or drive type unknown
	    80h there is no disk in the drive
	ES:DI -> 11-byte parameter table (see #01264 at INT 1E)
AH.19:
FIXED DISK - PARK HEADS ON ESDI DRIVE (XT286,PS)
	DL = drive
Return: CF set on error
	CF clear if successful
	AH = status (see #00234 at AH=01h)

AH.00:
MBBIOS - INITIALIZE PORT
	AL = port parameters (see #00302)
	DX = port number
Return: AH = line status (see #00304)
	AL = modem status (see #00305)
AH.01:
SERIAL - WRITE CHARACTER TO PORT
	AL = character to write
	DX = port number (00h-03h) (04h-43h for Digiboard XAPCM232.SYS)
Return: AH bit 7 clear if successful
	AH bit 7 set on error
	AH bits 6-0 = port status (see #00304)
AH.02:
FOSSIL - RECEIVE CHARACTER WITH WAIT
	DX = port number (0-3)
Return: AL = character received
	AH = 00h
AH.03:
SERIAL - GET PORT STATUS
	AL = 00h (ArtiCom)
	DX = port number (00h-03h) (04h-43h for Digiboard XAPCM232.SYS)
Return: AH = line status (see #00304)
	AL = modem status (see #00305)
	AX = 9E00h if disconnected (ArtiCom)
AH.04:
MBBIOS - INSTALLATION CHECK
	DX = port number
Return: AX = AA55h if installed on specified port
AH.05:
PC-MOS/386 v5.01 $serial.sys v5.04 - CHANGE PORT PROTOCOL
	AL = new port protocol (see #00336)
	BH = new XOFF character
	BL = new XON character
	DX = port number
Return: AH = FFh if invalid protocol
AH.06:
PC-MOS/386 v5.01 $serial.sys v5.04 - DRIVER 'ID' FUNCTION
	DX = port number
Return: AH bit 7 set
	AL = number of highest function supported by driver
AH.07:
PC-MOS/386 v5.01 $serial.sys v5.04 - SEND RS-232 BREAK
	BX = duration of break in clock ticks
	DX = port number
Return: nothing
AH.08:
PC-MOS/386 v5.01 $serial.sys v5.04 - INPUT STATUS CHECK
	DX = port number
Return: CF set if carrier loss detected
	ZF set if input buffer empty
	ZF clear if characters available
	    AL = next character dequeued
AH.09:
PC-MOS/386 v5.01 $serial.sys v5.04 - RESET I/O BUFFER POINTERS
	DX = port number
Return: nothing
AH.0A:
MBBIOS - WRITE BUFFER
	CX = count
	ES:DI -> buffer (see #00338)
Return: AX = status (see #00304,#00305)
	CX = unsent character count
	DI updated
AH.0B:
MBBIOS - READ BUFFER
	CX = size of buffer
	ES:DI -> buffer
Return: AH = composite line status (see #00304) formed by ORing all statuses
		  on receive interrupts; bit 0 set if additional characters
		  available
	AL = composite modem status (see #00305) formed by ORing all statuses
	CX = number of characters actually read
	DI updated
AH.0C:
MBBIOS PACCOM support - BUFFER MANAGEMENT
	ES = segment of buffer to free, or 0000h to allocate new buffer
Return: ES = segment of allocated buffer (if ES=0000h on entry)
AH.0D:
MBBIOS PACCOM support - SET TXD
	AL = new setting (FFh = 1.0)
Return: nothing
AH.0E:
MBBIOS PACCOM support - SET PERSISTENCE
	AL = new setting (FFh = 1.0)
Return: nothing
AH.0F:
MBBIOS PACCOM support - SET SLOT TIME
	AL = new setting in clock ticks
Return: nothing
AH.10:
MBBIOS PACCOM support - SET CRC WAIT
	AL = new setting in clock ticks (should be at least 5 character times)
Return: nothing
AH.11:
PC-MOS/386 v5.01 $serial.sys v5.04 - DISABLE PORT
	DX = port number
Return: AL = status
	    00h successful
	    01h IRQ for port is shared
	    02h IRQ was reserved
AH.12:
PC-MOS/386 v5.01 $serial.sys v5.04 - GET CURRENT PORT PARAMETERS
	DX = port number
Return: AH = status
	    FFh port number invalid
	AL = line parameters (see #00304)
	AH = flow control configuration (see #00336 at AH=05h"PC-MOS")
	CX:BX = bps rate
	DL = XOFF character or 00h for none
	DH = XON character or 00h for none
AH.13:
PC-MOS/386 v5.01 $serial.sys v5.04 - REGISTER A PORT WITH A TERMINAL
	DX = port number
Return: AH = status
	    FFh port number invalid
	    else
		ES:BX -> BYTE flag (00h buffer empty, FFh buffer contains data)
AH.14:
Digiboard - GET NUMBER OF BOARDS INSTALLED
Return: AX = number of boards installed
AH.15:
Digiboard - ENABLE/DISABLE MEMORY
	AL = new state (00h disabled, 01h enabled)
Return: AH = status
	    00h successful
	    80h error
	    FFh error
AH.16:
Digiboard DigiCHANNEL PC/X* - CCB COMMAND
	AL = CCB command number (see #00342) (see also following entries)
	BL = byte 2
	BH = byte 3
	CL = byte 1 (for all channel functions except 4Eh and 4Fh)
	DX = port number (00h-03h) (04h-43h for XAPCM232.SYS)
Return: AH = status
	    00h successful
	    80h error
	    FFh error
AH.17:
PC-MOS/386 v5.01 $serial.sys v5.04 - WRITE MODEM CONTROL REGISTER
	AL = new value for UART's modem control register
	DX = port number
Return: nothing
AH.18:
PC-MOS/386 v5.01 $serial.sys v5.04 - GET DRIVER DESCRIPTION
	DX = port number
Return: DS:BX -> 40-byte buffer containing a string identifying the serial
		driver
AH.19:
PC-MOS/386 v5.01 $serial.sys v5.04 - SELECTIVE BUFFER FLUSH
	AL = what to flush
	    bit 0: input buffer
	    bit 1: output buffer
	DX = port number
Return: nothing
AH.1A:
Digiboard DigiCHANNEL PC/X - SPECIAL CHARACTER FLAG/COUNTER
	BX = subfunction
	    00h return pointer to special character flag byte
	    01h return pointer to special character counter word
	DX = port number (00h-03h) (04h-43h for XAPCM232.SYS)
Return: ES:BX -> special character flag or counter
AH.1B:
FOSSIL - RETURN INFORMATION ABOUT THE DRIVER
	DX = port number
	CX = size of user buffer
	ES:DI -> user buffer for driver info (see #00343)
Return: AX = number of characters transferred
	CX = 3058h ("0X") (X00 FOSSIL only)
	DX = 2030h (" 0") (X00 FOSSIL only)
AH.1C:
X00 FOSSIL - ACTIVATE PORT
	DX = port number
Return: AX = 1954h if successful
	BL = maximum function number supported (not including 7Eh and above)
	BH = revision of FOSSIL specification supported
AH.1D:
X00 FOSSIL - DEACTIVATE PORT
	DX = port number
Return: none
AH.1E:
HUNTER 16 - READ COMMS PARAMETERS
	CX = channel number (00h COM1, 01h COM2, ...)
	DS:BX -> buffer for communications parameters (see #00347)
Return: DS:BX buffer filled
AH.1F:
X00 FOSSIL - EXTENDED SERIAL PORT STATUS/CONTROL
	DX = port number
	AL = direction
	    00h read modem control register
		Return: BL = modem control register (see #00349)
			AH = status
	    01h write modem control register
		BL = modem control register (see #00349)
		Return: AX = status
AH.20:
HUNTER 16 - SELECT COMMS PARAMETERS
	CX = channel number (00h COM1, 01h COM2, ...)
	DS:BX -> buffer with communications parameter (see #00347)
Return: AX = status
	    0000h successful
	    0001h invalid parameter
AH.21:
HUNTER 16 - EXTENDED CONTROL
	AL = command
	    01h force transmission of buffer
	    02h clear transmit buffer
	    03h clear receive buffer
	DX = port (00h COM1, 01h COM2)
Return: AH = extended status
AH.22:
HUNTER 16 - EXTENDED STATUS
	DX = port (00h COM1, 01h COM2)
Return: AH = extended status
	BX = number of characters in input buffer
	CX = number of characters in output buffer
AH.23:
HUNTER 16 - CONTROL HANDSHAKE LINES
	BH = handshake line to set (00h RTS, 01h DTR)
	BL = new level (00h low, 01h high)
Return: nothing
AH.24:
HUNTER 16 - CONTROL CTS HANDSHAKING
	AL = new CTS handshake state for COM1 (00h disabled, 01h enabled)
Return: nothing
AH.25:
HUNTER 16 - CONTROL RS232 DRIVERS
	AL = new state of RS232 drivers (00h off, 01h on)
Return: nothing
AH.26:
HUNTER 16 - CONTROL RI POWER UP
	AL = 00h enable RI power up
	    else disable RI power up
Return: nothing
AH.27:
HUNTER 16 - GET INSTALLED PROTOCOLS COUNT
	AL = number of extended protocols installed (since last call)
Return: AL = total number installed, including new ones
AH.28:
HUNTER 16 - GET PROTOCOL NAME
	AL = protocol handle
	DS:BX -> 8 character buffer for protocol name
Return: AH = status
	    00h successful
		DS:BX buffer filled with the protocol name
	    FFh failed
AH.29:
HUNTER 16 - GET PROTOCOL HANDLE
	DS:BX -> buffer containing the protocol name
Return: AH = status
	    00h successful
		AL = handle
	    FFh failed
AH.2A:
HUNTER 16 - EXTENDED PROTOCOL MENU
	AL = protocol handle
Return: AH = status
	    00h successful
	    FFh failed
	AL = menu handle
AH.2B:
HUNTER 16 - GET EXTENDED PROTOCOL PARAMETERS
	AL = protocol handle
	DS:BX -> buffer for extended protocol parameters
Return: AH = status
	    00h successful
		DS:BX buffer filled with extended parameters
	    FFh failed
AH.2C:
HUNTER 16 - SET DTR
	AL nonzero
	BL = new state
	    00h	 normal operation
	    else force DTR high
Return: AH = 00h
AH.56:
BWCOM14 - INSTALLATION CHECK
Return: CX = 0001h if installed
AH.57:
BWCOM14 - INITIALIZE
	DL = port number
Return: AL = initialization status (00h successful, 01h already initialized)
	CX = port status (0001h port redirected, 0002h and FFFFh failed)
AH.58:
BWCOM14 - SHUTDOWN
Return: CX = status (0001h successful, 0002h not initialized)
AH.7E:
FOSSIL - INSTALL AN EXTERNAL APPLICATION FUNCTION
	AL = code assigned to external application (80h-BFh)
	    80h reserved for communications FOSSIL
	    81h video FOSSIL
	    82h reserved for keyboard FOSSIL
	    83h reserved for system FOSSIL
	ES:DX -> entry point
Return: AX = 1954h
	BL = code assigned to application (same as input AL)
	DH = status
	    00h failed
	    01h successful
AH.7F:
FOSSIL - REMOVE AN EXTERNAL APPLICATION FUNCTION
	AL = code assigned to external application
	ES:DX -> entry point
Return: AX = 1954h
	BL = code assigned to application (same as input AL)
	DH = status
	    00h failed
	    01h successful
AH.80:
COURIERS.COM - INSTALLATION CHECK
Return: AH = E8h if loaded
AH.81:
COMM-DRV - EXTENDED INITIALIZATION
	BX:DI -> port control block (see #00367)
	DX = port number
Return: AH = line status register (see #00304)
	    error if bit 7 set
	AL = modem status register (see #00305)
AH.82:
COMM-DRV v14.0 - PORT CLEANUP
	DX = port number
Return: AH bit 7 set on error
	AH bit 7 clear if successful
AH.83:
COMM-DRV v14.0 - FLUSH COMMUNICATION BUFFERS
	DX = port number
	AL = subfunction
	    00h flush input buffer
	    01h flush output buffer
	    02h flush both buffers
Return: AH bit 7 set on error
	AH bit 7 clear if successful
AH.84:
COMM-DRV v14.0 - SEND PACKET
	CX = packet length in bytes
	DX = port number
	ES:DI -> packet to be sent
Return: AH = line status (see #00304)
	    bit 7 set on error
	AL destroyed
AH.85:
COMM-DRV v14.0 - RECEIVE PACKET
	CX = length of packet in bytes
	DX = port number
	ES:DI -> buffer for packet
Return: AH = line status (see #00304)
	    bit 7 set on error
	AL destroyed
AH.86:
COMM-DRV v14.0 - SET INPUT/OUTPUT TIMEOUTS
	BL = maximum clock ticks to wait before signalling error on input func
	BH = maximum clock ticks to wait before signalling error on output
	DX = port number
	SI = input timeout in clock ticks if BL=FFh and BH=FFh
	DI = output timeout in clock ticks if BL=FFh and BH=FFh
Return: AH bit 7 set on error
	AH bit 7 clear if successful
AH.87:
COMM-DRV v14.0 - TURN ON DTR
	DX = port number
Return: AH bit 7 set on error
	AH bit 7 clear if successful
AH.88:
COMM-DRV v14.0 - TURN OFF DTR
	DX = port number
Return: AH bit 7 set on error
	AH bit 7 clear if successful
AH.89:
COMM-DRV v14.0 - TURN ON RTS
	DX = port number
Return: AH bit 7 set on error
	AH bit 7 clear if successful
AH.8A:
COMM-DRV v14.0 - TURN OFF RTS
	DX = port number
Return: AH bit 7 set on error
	AH bit 7 clear if successful
AH.8B:
COMM-DRV v14.0 - SET USER INTERRUPT ROUTINE
	CX = bitmask of interrupt to process
	    00h = deinstall
	BX:DI -> DWORD containing address of function to be called
Return: AH bit 7 clear if successful
	AH bit 7 set on error
AH.8C:
COMM-DRV v14.0 - READ UART REGISTER
	AL = register offset
	DX = port number
Return: AH bit 7 set on error
	AH bit 7 clear if successful
	    AL = contents of UART register
AH.8D:
COMM-DRV v14.0 - WRITE UART REGISTER
	AL = register offset
	BL = new value for UART register
	DX = port number
Return: AH bit 7 set on error
	AH bit 7 clear if successful
AH.8E:
COMM-DRV v14.0 - READ PACKET NONDESTRUCTIVELY
	CX = length of packet in bytes
	DX = port number
	ES:DI -> buffer for packet
Return: AH = line status (see #00304)
	    bit 7 set on error (see AX=8000h"COMM-DRV")
	AL destroyed
AH.A0:
Interconnections Inc. TES - INSTALLATION CHECK/STATUS REPORT
	CX = FFFFh
Return: CF clear if successful
	    AX = 5445h ('TE')
	    CX <> FFFFh
	    DX = port number
	CF set on error
AH.A1:
Interconnections Inc. TES - GET LIST OF SESSIONS WITH STATUS
Return: CX = number of active sessions
	ES:SI -> status array (see #00395)
AH.A2:
Interconnections Inc. TES - GET LIST OF SERVER NAMES
Return: CX = number of servers
	ES:SI -> array of offsets from ES for server names
AH.A3:
Interconnections Inc. TES - START A NEW SESSION
	ES:SI -> ???
Return: CF clear if successful
	    AX = 5445h ('TE')
	    CX <> FFFFh
	    DX = port number
	CF set on error
AH.A4:
Interconnections Inc. TES - HOLD CURRENTLY ACTIVE SESSION
	???
Return: ???
AH.A5:
Interconnections Inc. TES - RESUME A SESSION
	AL = session number
Return: ???
AH.A6:
Interconnections Inc. TES - DROP A SESSION
	AL = session number
Return: AH = status
	    00h successful
	    else error
AH.A7:
Interconnections Inc. TES - SWITCH TO NEXT ACTIVE SESSION
	???
Return: ???
AH.A8:
Interconnections Inc. TES - SEND STRING TO COMMAND INTERPRETER
	AL = 00h no visible response
	ES:SI -> ASCIZ command
Return: ???
AH.B0:
3com BAPI SERIAL I/O - EN/DISABLE "ENTER COMMAND MODE" (ECM) CHARACTER
	AL = new state (00h disabled, 01h enabled)
Return: AH = return code (00h,07h,0Ah) (see #00394)
AH.B1:
3com BAPI SERIAL I/O - ENTER COMMAND MODE
Return: AH = return code (00h,07h,0Ah) (see #00394)
AH.B2:
3com BAPI SERIAL I/O - GET ECM WATCH STATE
Return: AH = return code (00h,07h,0Ah) (see #00394)
	AL = watch flag (00h disabled, 01h enabled)
AH.B3:
3com BAPI SERIAL I/O - GET/SET CONFIGURATION INFO
	AL = direction (00h get, 01h set)
	DH = session ID (00h for external session managment)
	DL = configuration item (00h = end-of-line mapping)
	CX = new configuration item value (if AL=01h)
	    ---if DL=00h---
	    CH = application EOL type (app to Telnet client)
		01h application will send lone CR
		02h application will send CR-? pair
	    CL = driver EOL type (Telnet client to Telnet server)
		01h driver should send CR-NUL pair
		02h driver should send CR-LF pair
Return: AH = return code (00h,03h,09h-0Bh) (see #00394)
	---if AL=00h---
	CX = configuration item value (above)
AH.F9:
IBM/Yale EBIOS SERIAL I/O - REGAIN CONTROL
	DX = port (00h-03h)
Return: nothing
AH.FA:
IBM/Yale EBIOS SERIAL I/O - SEND BREAK
	DX = port (00h-03h)
Return: nothing
AH.FB:
IBM/Yale EBIOS SERIAL I/O - SET OUTGOING MODEM SIGNALS
	AL = modem control register (see #00334 at AH=05h"SERIAL")
	DX = port (00h-03h)
Return: nothing
AH.FC:
IBM/Yale EBIOS SERIAL I/O - READ CHARACTER, NO WAIT
	DX = port (00h-03h)
Return: AH = RS232 status bits (see #00304 at AH=03h)
	AL = character

AX.0400:
Microsoft Systems Journal TSRCOMM INT14 - INSTALLATION CHECK
Return: AX = 0FF0h
AX.0401:
Microsoft Systems Journal TSRCOMM INT14 - INITIALIZE MODE
	CX = mode
Return: nothing
AX.0402:
Microsoft Systems Journal TSRCOMM INT14 - EXTENDED INITIALIZE
	CL = parameters
Return: nothing
AX.0403:
Microsoft Systems Journal TSRCOMM INT14 - SET TIMEOUT
	CX = timeout
Return: nothing
AX.0404:
Microsoft Systems Journal TSRCOMM INT14 - CLEAR THE RECEIVE BUFFER
Return: nothing
AX.0405:
Microsoft Systems Journal TSRCOMM INT14 - GET RECEIVE BUFFER COUNT
Return: AX = number of characters in buffer
AX.0406:
Microsoft Systems Journal TSRCOMM INT14 - CLEAR THE TRANSMIT BUFFER
Return: nothing
AX.0407:
Microsoft Systems Journal TSRCOMM INT14 - GET TRANSMIT BUFFER COUNT
Return: AX = number of characters in the buffer
AX.0408:
Microsoft Systems Journal TSRCOMM INT14 - UNINSTALL
Return: nothing
AX.0D00:
MBBIOS - GET AVAILABLE BYTES
Return: AX = bytes in transmit buffer
	CX = bytes in receive buffer
AX.0D01:
MBBIOS - LOWER ALL MODEM CONTROL SIGNALS
Return: nothing
AX.0D02:
MBBIOS - RAISE ALL MODEM CONTROL SIGNALS
Return: nothing
AX.0D03:
MBBIOS - SET HANDSHAKE BYTE
	CL = new handshake byte
Return: CL = previous handshake byte
AX.1646:
Digiboard - CCB COMMAND - SET INTERRUPT TO HOST MASK
	BL = bits to set
	BH = bits to clear
	CL = byte 1
	DX = port number (00h-03h) (04h-43h for XAPCM232.SYS)
Return: AH = status
	    00h successful
	    80h error
	    FFh error
AX.1647:
Digiboard - CCB COMMAND - SET BAUD/DATABITS/STOPBITS/PARITY
	BL = baud
	BH = datatype
	CL = byte 1
	DX = port number (00h-03h) (04h-43h for XAPCM232.SYS)
Return: AH = status
	    00h successful
	    80h error
	    FFh error
AX.1649:
Digiboard - CCB COMMAND - SET MODEM LINES
	BL = bits to set
	BH = bits to clear
	CL = byte 1
	DX = port number (00h-03h) (04h-43h for XAPCM232.SYS)
Return: AH = status
	    00h successful
	    80h error
	    FFh error
AX.164A:
Digiboard - CCB COMMAND - SET BREAK COUNT
	BL = break count
	CL = byte 1
	DX = port number (00h-03h) (04h-43h for XAPCM232.SYS)
Return: AH = status
	    00h successful
	    80h error
	    FFh error
AX.164B:
Digiboard - CCB COMMAND - SET HANDSHAKE
	BL = bits to set
	BH = bits to clear
	CL = byte 1
	DX = port number (00h-03h) (04h-43h for XAPCM232.SYS)
Return: AH = status
	    00h successful
	    80h error
	    FFh error
AX.164C:
Digiboard - CCB COMMAND - SET XON/XOFF CHARACTERS
	BL = XON character
	BH = XOFF character
	CL = byte 1
	DX = port number (00h-03h) (04h-43h for XAPCM232.SYS)
Return: AH = status
	    00h successful
	    80h error
	    FFh error
AX.164D:
Digiboard - CCB COMMAND - SET TRANSMIT MID-WATER MARK
	BX = new mid-water mark
	CL = byte 1
	DX = port number (00h-03h) (04h-43h for XAPCM232.SYS)
Return: AH = status
	    00h successful
	    80h error
	    FFh error
AX.164E:
Digiboard - CCB COMMAND - IRQ POLLING TIMER TO HOST
	BL = ticks
	BH = ???
	CL = mode
	DX = port number (00h-03h) (04h-43h for XAPCM232.SYS)
Return: AH = status
	    00h successful
	    80h error
	    FFh error
AX.164F:
Digiboard - CCB COMMAND - BUFFER SET ALL
	BL = size
	DX = port number (00h-03h) (04h-43h for XAPCM232.SYS)
Return: AH = status
	    00h successful
	    80h error
	    FFh error
AX.1653:
Digiboard - CCB COMMAND - SPECIAL CHARACTER INTERRUPT
	BL = enable/disable
	BH = special character
	CL = byte 1
	DX = port number (00h-03h) (04h-43h for XAPCM232.SYS)
Return: AH = status
	    00h successful
	    80h error
	    FFh error
AX.2C00:
HUNTER 16 - GET DTR
Return: AH = 00h
	BL = current state
	    00h	 normal DTR operation
	    else DTR is forced high
AX.6F00:
HP Vectra EX-BIOS - "F14_INQUIRE" - INSTALLATION CHECK
	BX <> 4850h (usually set to 0000h for simplicity)
Return: BX = 4850h ("HP") if HP Extended BIOS serial port extensions available
	AX destroyed
AX.6F01:
HP Vectra EX-BIOS - "F14_EXINIT" - INITIALIZE SERIAL PORT
	BX = port attributes (see #00356)
	DX = port number (0-3)
Return: AH = line status (see #00304)
	AL = modem status (see #00305)
AX.6F02:
HP Vectra EX-BIOS - "F14_PUT_BUFFER" - TRANSMIT BUFFER
	CX = number of characters in buffer
	DX = port number (0-3)
	ES:DI -> buffer containing characters
Return: AH = line status (see #00304)
	AL = modem status (see #00305)
	CX = number of bytes actually sent
	ES:DI -> next byte to be transferred (unchanged if all bytes sent)
AX.6F03:
HP Vectra EX-BIOS - "F14_GET_BUFFER" - READ DATA INTO BUFFER
	CX = size of buffer
	DX = port number (0-3)
	ES:DI -> buffer for received characters
Return: AH = line status (see #00304)
	---on error (AH bit 7 set)---
	   AL = 00h
	   ES:DI -> next byte to be transferred
	---if successful---
	   AL = last byte read
	   ES:DI unchanged
	CX = number of bytes read
AX.6F04:
HP Vectra EX-BIOS - "F14_TRM_BUFFER" - READ UNTIL TERMINATOR
	BL = lowest termination character
	BH = highest termination character
	CX = size of buffer
	DX = port number (0-3)
	ES:DI -> buffer for received characters
Return: AH = line status (see #00304)
	---on error (AH bit 7 set)---
	   AL = 00h
	   ES:DI -> next byte to be transferred
	---if successful---
	   AL = last byte read
	   ES:DI unchanged
	CX = number of bytes read
AX.8000:
COMM-DRV v14.0 - READ PORT METRICS - GET ERROR CODE AND BUFFER STATUS
	DX = port number
Return: AX = code for last error (see #00357)
	BX = number of characters in output buffer
	CX = nubmer of characters in input buffer
	DX = state flag (see #00358)
AX.8001:
COMM-DRV v14.0 - READ PORT METRICS - GET PORT PARAMETERS
	DX = port number
Return: BX:DI -> Port Control Block (see #00367)
AX.8002:
COMM-DRV v14.0 - READ PORT METRICS - GET PORT PARAMETERS
	DX = port number
Return: AH bit 7 set on error
	AH bit 7 clear if successful
	    BX:DI -> Port Control Block (see #00367) (modifyable portion only)
AX.8003:
COMM-DRV v14.0 - READ PORT METRICS - GET I/O BUFFER SIZES
	DX = port number
Return: AX = number of characters in input buffer
	BX = input buffer size
	CX = number of characters in output buffer
	DX = output buffer size
AX.8004:
ARTICOM - ATTACH ASYNCHRONOUS RESOURCE
	DX = port to redirect (COM1=0, COM2=1, ...)
	CH = attach type
	CL = adapter to use for attach, 0FFh to search all
	ES:DI -> attachment structure (see #00361)
Return: AX = error code, if error (see #00360)
AX.8005:
ARTICOM - DETACH ASYNCHRONOUS RESOURCE
	DX = port to detach (COM1=0, COM2=1, ...)
Return: AX = error code, if error (see #00360)
AX.8006:
ARTICOM - GET RESOURCE INFORMATION
	BX = remote port (COM1=0, COM2=1, ...)
	CL = adapter number, FFh to try all adapters
	ES:DI -> resource information structure (see #00362)
	DS:SI -> 16 byte server name. See note.
Return: AX = error code, if error (see #00360)
	BX = next remote port, recall to get next resource info
AX.8007:
ARTICOM - GET REDIRECTED PORT INFORMATION
	DX = port index (COM1=0, COM2=1, ...)
	ES:DI -> buffer for port information structure (see #00363)
Return: CF clear if redirection info returned and port is redirected
	CF set if not a redirected port
	AX = error code, if error (see #00360)
AX.8008:
ARTICOM - GET AVAILABLE SERVER NAME
	BX = server index (0,1,...)
	ES:DI -> server name structure (see #00365)
Return: AX = error code, if error (see #00360)
	BX = next remote port, repeat call to get next available server
AX.8009:
ARTICOM - SET SEND AND RECEIVE TIMEOUTS
	BX = send timeout in ticks
	CX = receive timeout in ticks
	DX = port index (COM1=0, COM2=1, ...)
Return: nothing
AX.800A:
ARTICOM - MODIFY FLOW CONTROL
	BL = flow control type (00h none, 01h XON/XOFF, 02h RTS/CTS)
	DX = port index (COM1=0, COM2=1, ...)
Return: AX = error code, if error (see #00360)
AX.8025:
ARTICOM - SET INTERNAL SEND/RECEIVE VECTOR
	DS:DX -> address of trap function (see #00366) to call on read/write
Return: nothing
AX.8035:
ARTICOM - GET INTERNAL SEND/RECEIVE VECTOR
Return: ES:BX -> address of current send/receive routine
AX.8100:
VIDEO FOSSIL - RETURN VFOSSIL INFORMATION
	ES:DI -> buffer for VFOSSIL information (see #00368)
Return: AX = 1954h if installed
AX.8101:
VIDEO FOSSIL - OPEN VFOSSIL
	ES:DI -> buffer for application function table (see #00369)
	CX = length of buffer in bytes
Return: AX = 1954h if installed
	    BH = highest VFOSSIL application function supported
AX.8102:
VIDEO FOSSIL - CLOSE VFOSSIL
Return: AX = 1954h
AX.AA01:
DimVGA v2.0+ - INSTALLATION CHECK
Return: AX = FFFFh if installed, unchanged
	BX = version (v1.5+ only), BH = major, BL = minor (v1.5 = 0105h)
	CX = resident segment (v3.1+)
AX.AA02:
DimVGA v2.0+ - SET TIME-OUT (DIMMING/BLANKING) PERIOD
	BX = number of clock ticks
Return: AX = FFFFh
AX.AA03:
DimVGA v2.0+ - SET DIMMING FACTOR
	BX = percentage remaining visible (1-99)
Return: AX = FFFFh
AX.AA04:
DimVGA v2.0+ - GET TIME-OUT PERIOD
Return: AX = FFFFh
	BX = current time-out in clock ticks
AX.AA05:
DimVGA v2.0+ - GET DIMMING FACTOR
Return: AX = FFFFh
	BX = current dimming factor
AX.AA06:
DimVGA v2.0+ - DISABLE
Return: AX = FFFFh
AX.AA07:
DimVGA v2.0+ - ENABLE
Return: AX = FFFFh
AX.AA08:
DimVGA v2.0+ - DIM SCREEN 'MANUALLY'
Return: AX = FFFFh
AX.AA09:
DimVGA v2.0+ - UNDIM SCREEN 'MANUALLY'
Return: AX = FFFFh
AX.AA0A:
DimVGA v2.0+ - CHECK WHETHER ENABLED
Return: AX = FFFFh
	BX = current state (0000h disabled, 0001h enabled)
AX.AA0B:
DimVGA v2.1+ - SET HOTKEY
	BH = shift state (see #00396)
	BL = keyboard scancode
Return: AX = FFFFh
AX.AA0C:
DimVGA v2.1+ - GET HOTKEY
Return: AX = FFFFh
	BH = shift state (see #00396)
	BL = keyboard scancode
AX.AA0D:
DimVGA v3.0+ - SET MOUSE CHECK STATUS
	BX = new mouse check status
	    0000h mouse checking off
	    0001h mouse checking on
Return: AX = FFFFh
AX.AA0E:
DimVGA v3.0+ - GET MOUSE CHECK STATUS
Return: BX = mouse check status (0000h disabled, 0001h enabled)
AX.AA0F:
DimVGA v3.4 - SET LOCKING STATUS
	BX = locking status
	    0000h disabled
	    0001h enabled
Return: AX = FFFFh
AX.AA10:
DimVGA v3.4 - GET MOUSE CHECK STATUS
Return: BX = locking status (0000h disabled, 0001h enabled)
AX.AF00:
3com BAPI SERIAL I/O - INSTALLATION CHECK
	BX = AAAAh
Return: AX = AF01h if installed
	    BH = protocol type (if BX=AAAAh on entry)
		01h NetManage TCP/IP
	    BL = version for protocol type (if BX=AAAAh on entry)
AX.E000:
MX5 Extended FOSSIL - GET MNP STATUS BLOCK
	DX = port number (0-3)
Return: ES:BX -> status block (see #00398)
AX.E001:
MX5 Extended FOSSIL - GET/SET MNP LEVEL
	BH = function
	    00h get MNP level
	    01h set MNP level
		BL = new level (00h none, 02h/04h/05h MNP level N)
	DX = port number (0-3)
Return: BL = MNP level
AX.E002:
MX5 Extended FOSSIL - GET/SET MNP ANSWER/ORIGINATE MODE
	BH = function
	    00h get answer/originate mode
	    01h set mode
		BL = new mode (00h originate [default], 01h answer)
	DX = port number (0-3)
Return: BL = answer/originate mode
AX.E003:
MX5 Extended FOSSIL - GET/SET MNP WAIT TICKS
	BH = function
	    00h get wait ticks
	    01h set wait ticks
		BL = MNP wait ticks (default 0Eh)
	DX = port number (0-3)
Return: BL = wait ticks
AX.E004:
MX5 Extended FOSSIL - GET/SET MNP CONNECT SOUND LEVEL
	BH = function
	    00h get sound level
	    01h set sound level
		BL = new sound level (00h off, 01h on [default])
	DX = port number
Return: BL = sound state
AX.E005:
MX5 Extended FOSSIL - UNINSTALL
Return: BX = segment of MX5's memory block or 0000h on failure
AX.E006:
MX5 Extended FOSSIL - INSTALLATION CHECK
	BX = 0000h
Return: BX = 4D58h ('MX') if installed
	    AH = major version
	    AL = minor version
AX.E007:
MX5 Extended FOSSIL - WAIT SPECIFIED NUMBER OF TICKS
	CX = number of ticks to wait
Return: nothing
AX.F4FF:
IBM/Yale EBIOS SERIAL I/O - INSTALLATION CHECK
	DX = port (00h-03h)
Return: CF clear if present
	    AX = 0000h
	CF set if not present
	    AX <> 0000h
AX.FD02:
IBM/Yale EBIOS SERIAL I/O - READ STATUS
Return: CX = number of characters available
AX.FF01:
IBM/Yale EBIOS SERIAL I/O - SET SEND BUFFER
	CX = length of buffer (0000h to cancel buffer assignment)
	DX = port (00h-03h)
	ES:BX -> send buffer
Return: nothing
AX.FF02:
IBM/Yale EBIOS SERIAL I/O - SET RECEIVE BUFFER
	CX = length of buffer (0000h to cancel buffer assignment)
	DX = port (00h-03h)
	ES:BX -> receive buffer
Return: nothing
AX.FFF8:
COMM-DRV v14.0 - SET BAUD RATE DIVISOR
	BX = card type (sub-device number)
	CX = new baudrate divisor
	DX = index to baud rate
Return: AH bit 7 set on error
	AH bit 7 clear if successful
AX.FFFB:
COMM-DRV v14.0 - GET HIGHEST ALLOWED PORT NUMBER
	DX = port number
Return: AH bit 7 set on error
	AH bit 7 clear if successful
	    BX = highest port number
AX.FFFC:
COMM-DRV v14.0 - GET INT 14 FLAGS
	DX = port number
Return: AH bit 7 set on error
	AH bit 7 clear if successful
	    BX = flags (see #00403)
AX.FFFD:
COMM-DRV v14.0 - SET INT 14 FLAGS
	BX = flags (see #00403)
	DX = port number
Return: AH bit 7 set on error
	AH bit 7 clear if successful
AX.FFFE:
COMM-DRV v14.0 - RESTORE INT 14 VECTOR TO ORIGINAL
Return: AH bit 7 set on error
	AH bit 7 clear if successful
AX.FFFF:
COMM-DRV v14.0 - GET INT 14 INFORMATION AREA
	BX:SI -> DWORD buffer for address of information area (see #00404)
		  (initialized to zeros)
Return: BX:SI buffer filled with nonzero value if installed

AH.00:
MultiDOS Plus - GIVE UP TIME SLICE
Return: nothing
AH.01:
MultiDOS Plus - REQUEST RESOURCE SEMAPHORE
	AL = semaphore number (00h-3Fh)
Return: AH = status
	    00h successful
	    02h invalid semaphore number
AH.02:
MultiDOS Plus - RELEASE RESOURCE SEMAPHORE
	AL = semaphore number (00h-3Fh)
Return: AH = status
	    00h successful
	    01h not semaphore owner
	    02h invalid semaphore number
AH.03:
MultiDOS Plus - SUSPEND TASK FOR INTERVAL
	DX = number of time slices to remain suspended
Return: after specified interval has elapsed
AH.04:
MultiDOS Plus - SEND MESSAGE TO ANOTHER TASK
	AL = mailbox number (00h-3Fh)
	CX = message length in bytes
	DS:SI -> message
Return: AH = status
	    00h successful
	    01h out of message memory
	    02h invalid mailbox number
AH.05:
MultiDOS Plus - CHECK MAILBOX
	AL = mailbox number (00h-3Fh)
Return: AH = status
	    00h successful
		DX = length of first message in queue, 0000h if no message
	    02h invalid mailbox number
AH.06:
MultiDOS Plus - READ MAILBOX
	AL = mailbox number (00h-3Fh)
	CX = size of buffer in bytes
	ES:DI -> buffer for message
Return: AH = status
	    00h successful
		CX = number of bytes copied
		DX = actual length of message
	    02h invalid mailbox number
AH.07:
MultiDOS Plus - SPAWN INTERNAL TASK (CREATE NEW THREAD)
	BX:CX = entry point of new task
	DX = stack size in paragraphs
Return: AH = status
	    00h successful
	    01h no free task control blocks
	    02h no free memory for task's stack
AH.08:
MultiDOS Plus - TERMINATE INTERNAL TASK (KILL THREAD)
Return: calling task terminated, so execution never returns to caller
AH.09:
MultiDOS Plus - CHANGE TASK'S PRIORITY
	AL = new priority
Return: nothing
AH.0A:
MultiDOS Plus - CHANGE TIME SLICE INTERVAL
	AL = new interval
	    00h = 55.0 ms (default)
	    80h = 27.5 ms
	    40h = 13.75 ms
	    20h = 6.88 ms
	    10h = 3.44 ms
	    08h = 1.72 ms
AH.0B:
MultiDOS Plus - FORCE DISPLAY OUTPUT TO PHYSICAL SCREEN MEMORY
Return: nothing
AH.0C:
MultiDOS Plus - RESTORE OLD VIDEO DISPLAY MEMORY
Return: nothing
AH.0D:
MultiDOS Plus - DISABLE MULTITASKING
Return: nothing
AH.0E:
MultiDOS Plus - ENABLE MULTITASKING
Return: nothing
AH.0F:
MultiDOS Plus - EXECUTE A MULTIDOS PLUS COMMAND
	DS:BX -> ASCIZ command
Return: after command has been processed
AH.10:
MultiDOS Plus - TEST RESOURCE SEMAPHORE
	AL = semaphore number (00h-3Fh)
Return: AH = status
	    00h semaphore not in use
	    01h semaphore owned by another task
	    02h invalid semaphore number
	    03h semaphore owned by caller
AH.11: MultiDOS Plus - TURN OFF AltZ TOGGLE
AH.12: MultiDOS Plus - TURN ON AltZ TOGGLE
AH.13:
MultiDOS Plus - GET TASK CONTROL BLOCK
Return: BX:AX -> task control block (see #00456)
AH.14:
MultiDOS Plus - CHECK IF MultiDOS FOREGROUND OR BACKGROUND
Return: AX = current state
	    0000h MultiDOS Plus command prompt is background task
	    0001h command prompt is foreground task
AH.15:
MultiDOS Plus - GET SYSTEM BLOCK
Return: BX:AX -> system block (see #00457)
AH.17:
MultiDOS Plus - MAP IRQ
	AL = IRQ to map (01h-0Fh)
	BX = offset of task control block (see #00456) to associate with IRQ
Return: AX = status
	    0000h successful
	    other invalid IRQ
AH.18:
MultiDOS Plus - UNMAP IRQ
	AL = IRQ to unmap (01h-0Fh)
Return: AX = status
	    0000h successful
	    0001h invalid IRQ
AH.19:
MultiDOS Plus - UNMAP ALL IRQs
Return: AX destroyed
AH.1A:
MultiDOS Plus - MAP SEMAPHORE NAME TO NUMBER
	DS:SI -> 8-byte name
Return: AL = status
	    00h successful
		AH = semaphore number (20h-3Fh)
	    04h out of string space
AH.1B:
MultiDOS Plus - REQUEST RESOURCE SEMAPHORE BY NAME
	DS:SI -> 8-byte name
Return: AH = status
	    00h successful
	    02h invalid semaphore number
	    03h caller already owns semaphore
	    04h out of string space
AH.1C:
MultiDOS Plus - RELEASE RESOURCE SEMAPHORE BY NAME
	DS:SI -> 8-byte name
Return: AH = status
	    00h successful
	    01h not semaphore owner
	    02h invalid semaphore number
	    04h out of string space
AH.1D:
MultiDOS Plus - TEST RESOURCE SEMAPHORE BY NAME
	DS:SI -> 8-byte name
Return: AH = status
	    00h semaphore not in use
	    01h semaphore owned by another task
	    02h invalid semaphore number
	    03h caller owns semaphore
	    04h out of string space
AH.1E:
VMiX v2+ - "sys_setfont" - SET CONSOLE GRAPHICS FONT
	STACK: WORD new font number (00h-03h)
Return: AX = current font number (00h-03h)
AH.1F:
MultiDOS Plus v4.01 - GET MEMORY PARAMETERS
Return: BX = first segment of conventional memory
	DX = first segment of EMS swap frame into which MultiDOS will load
		programs
AH.20:
MultiDOS Plus v4.01 - CHECK IF MULTITASKING ENABLED
Return: AX = current state
	    0000h multitasking enabled
	    other TCB of task that disabled multitasking
AH.21:
SYSTEM - POWER-ON SELF-TEST ERROR LOG (PS50+)
	AL = subfunction
	    00h read POST log
	    01h write POST log
		BH = device ID
		BL = error code
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
	AH = status
	    00h OK
	    01h list full
	    02h unsupported subfunction
	    80h invalid command
	    86h unsupported function
	if function 00h:
	   BX = number of error codes stored
	   ES:DI -> error log
AH.22:
SYSTEM - later PS/2s - LOCATE ROM BASIC
Return: CF set on error
	    AH = status (86h if function not supported)
	CF clear on success
	    AH = 00h
	    ES:BX -> ROM BASIC
AH.40:
SYSTEM - READ/MODIFY PROFILES (CONVERTIBLE)
	AL = subfunction
	    00h get system profile in CX and BX
	    01h set system profile from CX and BX
	    02h get internal modem profile in BX
	    03h set internal modem profile from BX
Return: CF clear if successful
	    AH = 00h
	CF set on error
	    AH = status (80h = profile execution failed)
AH.41:
SYSTEM - WAIT ON EXTERNAL EVENT (CONVERTIBLE and some others)
	AL = condition type (see #00463)
	BH = condition compare or mask value
	BL = timeout value times 55 milliseconds
	    00h means no timeout
	DX = I/O port address if AL bit 4 set
	ES:DI -> user byte if AL bit 4 clear
Return: after event or timeout occurs
AH.42:
SYSTEM - REQUEST POWER OFF (CONVERTIBLE,HP 95LX)
	AL = suspend type
	    00h to use system profile
	    01h to force suspend regardless of system profile
Return: nothing
AH.43:
SYSTEM - READ SYSTEM STATUS (CONVERTIBLE)
Return: AL = status bits (see #00464)
AH.44:
SYSTEM - (DE)ACTIVATE INTERNAL MODEM POWER (CONVERTIBLE)
	AL = new modem power state (00h power off, 01h power on)
Return: nothing
AH.49:
HP 100LX/200LX - SERIAL INTERFACE SELECT
	AL = serial interface
	    00h wired (COM1)
	    01h infrared
AH.4A:
HP 100LX/200LX - SERIAL INTERFACE CONTROL
	AL = control
	    00h deactivate
	    01h activate
AH.4F:
KEYBOARD - KEYBOARD INTERCEPT (AT model 3x9,XT2,XT286,CONV,PS)
	AL = hardware scan code (see #00006)
	CF set
Return: CF set to continue processing scan code
	   AL = possibly-altered hardware scan code (see #00006)
	CF clear
	   scan code should be ignored
AH.50:
VMIX v2.???+ - "sys_vm_page" - SET NEW VIRTUAL PAGE TABLE
	BX = segment of page directory table
	CX = page number of page table
AH.51:
VMiX v2.???+ - "sys_vm_func" - EXECUTE FUNCTION IN PROTECTED MODE
	STACK:	DWORD	selector:offset of function
Return: registers as returned by function
AH.80:
OS HOOK - DEVICE OPEN (AT,XT286,PS)
	BX = device ID
	CX = process ID
	CF clear
Return: CF clear if successful
	    AH = 00h
	CF set on error
	    AH = status (see #00496)
AH.81:
OS HOOK - DEVICE CLOSE
	BX = device ID
	CX = process ID
	CF clear
Return: CF clear if successful
	    AH = 00h
	CF set on error
	    AH = status (see #00496)
AH.82:
OS HOOK - PROGRAM TERMINATION
	BX = process ID
	CF clear
Return: CF clear if successful
	    AH = 00h
	CF set on error
	    AH = status (see #00496)
AH.83:
BIOS - SET EVENT WAIT INTERVAL (AT,PS50+)
	AL = subfunction
	    00h set interval
		CX:DX = microseconds to delay
		ES:BX -> byte whose high bit is to be set at end of interval
	    01h cancel wait interval
Return: CF set on error or function already busy
	    AH = status
		80h invalid command (PC,PCjr)
		86h function not supported (XT and later)
	CF clear if successful
AH.84:
BIOS - JOYSTICK SUPPORT (XT after 1982/11/8,AT,XT286,PS)
	DX = subfunction
	    0000h read joystick switches
		Return: AL bits 7-4 = switch settings
	    0001h read positions of joysticks
		Return: AX = X position of joystick A
			BX = Y position of joystick A
			CX = X position of joystick B
			DX = Y position of joystick B
Return: CF set on error
	    AH = status (see #00496)
	CF clear if successful
AH.85:
OS HOOK - SysReq KEY ACTIVITY (AT,PS)
	AL = SysReq key action (00h pressed, 01h released)
	CF clear
Return: CF clear if successful
	    AH = 00h
	CF set on error
	    AH = status (see #00496)
AH.86:
BIOS - WAIT (AT,PS)
	CX:DX = interval in microseconds
Return: CF clear if successful (wait interval elapsed)
	CF set on error or AH=83h wait already in progress
	    AH = status (see #00496)
AH.87:
SYSTEM - COPY EXTENDED MEMORY
	CX = number of words to copy (max 8000h)
	ES:SI -> global descriptor table (see #00499)
Return: CF set on error
	CF clear if successful
	AH = status (see #00498)
AH.88:
SYSTEM - GET EXTENDED MEMORY SIZE (286+)
Return: CF clear if successful
	    AX = number of contiguous KB starting at absolute address 100000h
	CF set on error
	    AH = status
		80h invalid command (PC,PCjr)
		86h unsupported function (XT,PS30)
AH.89:
SYSTEM - SWITCH TO PROTECTED MODE
	BL = interrupt number of IRQ0 (IRQ1-7 use next 7 interrupts)
	BH = interrupt number of IRQ8 (IRQ9-F use next 7 interrupts)
	ES:SI -> GDT for protected mode (see #00500)
Return: CF set on error
	   AH = FFh  error enabling address line 20
	CF clear if successful
	   AH = 00h
	   in protected mode at specified address
	   BP may be destroyed; all segment registers change
AH.90:
OS HOOK - DEVICE BUSY (AT,PS)
	AL = device type (see #00507)
	ES:BX -> request block for type codes 80h through BFh
	CF clear
Return: CF set if wait time satisfied
	CF clear if driver must perform wait
	    AH = 00h
AH.91:
OS HOOK - DEVICE POST (AT,PS)
	AL = device type (see #00507)
	ES:BX -> request block for type codes 80h through BFh
	CF clear
Return: AH = 00h
AH.A0:
IBM SurePath BIOS - ACCESS LOADABLE-ABIOS SIGNATURE
	AL = function
	    00h get loadable-ABIOS signature
		Return: BL = signature value
			    00h loadable-ABIOS prompting not required
			    A1h loadable-ABIOS prompting is required
	    01h write loadable-ABIOS signature
		BL = new signature value
		    00h loadable-ABIOS prompting not required
		    A1h loadable-ABIOS prompting is required
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
	AH = status
	    00h successful
	    01h invalid subfunction
	    02h unable to read/write signature
	    86h function not supported
AH.C0:
SYSTEM - GET CONFIGURATION (XT >1986/1/10,AT mdl 3x9,CONV,XT286,PS)
Return: CF set if BIOS doesn't support call
	CF clear on success
	    ES:BX -> ROM table (see #00509)
	AH = status
	    00h successful
		The PC XT (since 1986/01/10), PC AT (since 1985/06/10), the
		  PC XT Model 286, the PC Convertible and most PS/2 machines
		  will clear the CF flag and return the table in ES:BX.
	    80h unsupported function
		The PC and PCjr return AH=80h/CF set
	    86h unsupported function
		The PC XT (1982/11/08), PC Portable, PC AT (1984/01/10),
		or PS/2 prior to Model 30 return AH=86h/CF set
AH.C1:
SYSTEM - RETURN EXTENDED-BIOS DATA-AREA SEGMENT ADDRESS (PS)
Return: CF set on error
	CF clear if successful
	    ES = segment of data area (see #M0001,#M0004,#M0005)
AH.C2:
IBM SurePath BIOS - Officially "Private" Function
	AL = 10h-23h
AH.C3:
SYSTEM - ENABLE/DISABLE WATCHDOG TIMEOUT (PS50+)
	AL = function
	    00h disable PS/2 watchdog timer
	    01h enable PS/2 watchdog timer
		BX = timer counter (0001h-00FFh)
	    02h disable Gearbox system
	    03h enable Gearbox system
Return: CF set on error
	CF clear if successful
AH.C4:
SYSTEM - PROGRAMMABLE OPTION SELECT (PS50+)
	AL = subfunction
	    00h return base POS register address
	    01h enable selected slot for setup
		BL = slot number (1 to 8)
	    02h disable setup for all slots (enable adapter)
Return: CF set on error
	DX = base POS register address (if subfunction 00h)
AH.C5:
OS HOOK - ROM BIOS TRACING CALLOUT (PS30/286,PS50Z,PS95)
	AL = interrupt being invoked
	    01h INT 19
	    02h INT 14
	    03h INT 16
	    04h INT 40 (floppy INT 13)
	    05h INT 17
	    06h INT 10
	    07h INT 12
	    08h INT 11
	    09h INT 1A
Return: all registers except AX must be preserved
AH.C6:
later PS/2 models - GET POS DATA
	???
Return: ???
AH.C7:
SYSTEM - later PS/2s - RETURN MEMORY-MAP INFORMATION
	DS:SI -> user supplied memory map table (see #00526)
Return: CF set on error
	CF clear if successful
AH.C8:
SYSTEM - ENABLE/DISABLE PROCESSOR FUNCTIONS
	AL = function
	    00h disable L1 cache
	    01h enable L1 cache
	    ---models 90 and 95 only---
	    02h disable L2 cache
	    03h enable L2 cache
	    04h disable both caches
	    05h enable both caches
	    06h return status of both caches
	    07h-FFh Reserved
Return: CF set on error
	CF clear if successful
	AH = status (see #00527)
	For subfunction 06h only:
	    BL = status of L1 cache
		00h enabled
		01h disabled or not installed
		02h disabled due to test error (can not be enabled)
	    BH = status of L2 cache (same codes as BL)
AH.C9:
newer PS/2; various BIOSes - GET CPU TYPE AND MASK REVISION
	AL = 10h (may be required on some non-PS BIOSes)
Return: CF clear if successful
	    AH = 00h
	    CH = CPU type (see #00528)
	    CL = mask revision (stepping level) (see #00529)
	CF set on error
	    AH = status (80h,86h = function not supported)
AH.CA:
PS/2 Model 95 - READ/WRITE CMOS MEMORY
	AL = function
	    00h read CMOS
		Return: CL = value of CMOS location
	    01h write CMOS
		CL = new value for CMOS location
	BL = CMOS location (0Eh-3Fh)
Return: CF clear if successful
	    AH = 00h
	CF set on error
	    AH = error code (see #00530)
AH.CE:
later PS/2s - ALLOCATE DMA ARBITRATION LEVEL
	BL = 00h-0Eh arbitration level to be allocated
	     0Fh-FFh reserved
	AL = option byte
	    bit 7-1: reserved (0)
	    bit 0: 0 = need DMA channel for arbitration level requested
		   1 = no channel required for arbitration level
Return: CF set on error
	    AH = status (80h,86h = function not supported)
	CF clear on success
	    AL = channel number
		00h-07h channel number allocated for the arbiration level
		08h-FEh reserved
		FFh	no channel requested for arbitration level
	    AH = status (see #00531)
AH.CF:
later PS/2s - DEALLOCATE DMA ARBITRATION LEVEL
	BL = arbitration level to be deallocated (see AH=CEh)
Return: CF set on error
	    AH = status (80h,86h = function not supported)
	CF clear on success
	    AH = status
		00h success
		04h arbitration level not allocated
AH.D4:
later PS/2s - GET PHYSICAL FIXED DISK DRIVE NUMBER (SELECTABLE BOOT)
	DL = logical fixed disk drive number
Return: AH = return code (see #00537)
	CF set on error
	CF clear on success
	    AL = physical fixed disk drive number

AH.00:
KEYBOARD - GET KEYSTROKE
Return: AH = BIOS scan code
	AL = ASCII character
AH.01:
KEYBOARD - CHECK FOR KEYSTROKE
Return: ZF set if no keystroke available
	ZF clear if keystroke available
	    AH = BIOS scan code
	    AL = ASCII character
AH.02:
KEYBOARD - GET SHIFT FLAGS
Return: AL = shift flags (see #00582)
	AH destroyed by many BIOSes
AH.03:
KEYBOARD - SET TYPEMATIC RATE AND DELAY
	AL = subfunction
	    00h set default delay and rate (PCjr and some PS/2)
	    01h increase delay before repeat (PCjr)
	    02h decrease repeat rate by factor of 2 (PCjr)
	    03h increase delay and decrease repeat rate (PCjr)
	    04h turn off typematic repeat (PCjr and some PS/2)
	    05h set repeat rate and delay (AT,PS)
		BH = delay value (00h = 250ms to 03h = 1000ms)
		BL = repeat rate (00h=30/sec to 0Ch=10/sec [def] to 1Fh=2/sec)
	    06h get current typematic rate and delay (newer PS/2s)
		Return: BL = repeat rate (above)
			BH = delay (above)
Return: AH destroyed by many BIOSes
AH.04:
KEYBOARD - SET KEYCLICK (PCjr only)
	AL = keyclick state
	    00h off
	    01h on
Return: AH destroyed by many BIOSes
AH.05:

	AL = function
	    01h set keyboard layout to French
	    02h set keyboard layout to German
	    03h set keyboard layout to Italian
	    04h set keyboard layout to Spanish
	    05h set keyboard layout to UK
	    80h check if function supported
		Return: AL <> 80h if supported
Return: ???
	AH destroyed by many BIOSes

Return: AL = supported keyboard functions (see #00585)
	AH destroyed by many BIOSes

	AH = shift flags 2 (see #00588)
