		CH = major version number
		CL = minor version number
		DX = flags
		    bit 0: running under DPMI
		    bit 1: running under Phar Lap VMM
		if running under DPMI:
		    BX = DPMI version (BH = major, BL = minor)
AX.ED03:
Phar Lap 386/DOS-Extender v4.1 - GET EXTENDER ENTRY POINT
	CX = real-mode code segment
	DX = real-mode data segment
Return: CF clear if successful
	    CX = protected-mode code segment selector
	    DX = protected-mode data segment selector
	    ES:DI -> real-mode entry point for calling protected-mode functions
		      (see INT 21/AX=250Dh)
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code
		0008h unable to allocate LDT descriptors
AX.ED10:
Pharlap DOS Extender - ???
	BL = 05h
	ES:SI -> ??? structure
Return: AX = ???
	SI = ???
	DI = ???
AX.ED11:
Pharlap DOS Extender - FATAL EXIT TO REAL MODE ???
	BL = 05h
	CX = ???
	DX = ???
	ES:SI -> ??? structure
	SS:SP = new stack ???
Return: ???
AX.ED80:
Phar Lap 286|DOS Extender Lite v2.5 - ???
	BL = DOS extender ID (see #03110)
	SI = 5048h ("PH")
	DI = 4152h ("AR")
	???
Return: ???
AX.F100:
DOS EXTENDER INSTALLATION CHECK
Return: AL = FFh if DOS extender present
	    SI = 444Fh ("DO")
	    DI = 5358h ("SX")
AX.FB43:
Borland C++ 3.0 DPMILOAD.EXE - NULL FUNCTION
	BX = subfunction (at least 0000h-000Eh)
AX.FBA1:
TKERNEL (Borland DOS extender) - UNINSTALL
	BX = 0084h
	ES:DI -> response buffer (see #03137)
Return: ES:DI buffer filled
AX.FEEF:
RTS Control TSR - INSTALLATION CHECK
Return: AX = EFFEh if installed
	    BX = port address

AH.13:
DOS 3.2+ - SET DISK INTERRUPT HANDLER
	DS:DX -> interrupt handler disk driver calls on read/write
	ES:BX = address to restore INT 13 to on system halt (exit from root
		 shell) or warm boot (INT 19)
Return: DS:DX set by previous invocation of this function
	ES:BX set by previous invocation of this function
AH.23:
DR DOS 5.0 GRAFTABL - GET GRAPHICS DATA
	AL nonzero
Return: AH = FFh
	ES:BX -> graphics data (8 bytes for each character from 80h to FFh)
AH.2E:
Novell DOS 7 - GRAFTABL - GET FONT TABLE
	AL nonzero
Return: AH = FFh if installed
	    ES:BX -> graphics data (8 bytes per character from 80h to FFh)
AH.44:
DOS Extender support???
	AL = function (at least 0Bh, 15h, 17h)
	???
Return: ???
AH.46:
Windows/286 DOS Extender
	AL = subfunction (03h,04h)
Return: ???
AH.93:
InnerMission v1.7+ - INSTALLATION CHECK
	BX = CX = AX
Return: AL = state
	    FFh if installed and BX=CX=AX on entry
		BX = segment of resident code
	    01h if installed but BX or CX differ from AX (multiplex number not
		  available)
AH.A1:
Ergo DOS extenders - INSTALLATION CHECK
	BX = 0081h
	AL = which
	    FEh OS/286,OS/386
	    FFh HummingBoard DOS extender
	ES:DI -> 16-byte buffer
Return: if installed, first four bytes of ES:DI buffer are "IABH"
AH.F1:
RTKernel v4.0 - INSTALLATION CHECK
	AL = 00h
Return: AX = FFFFh if present
	    CX = 00F1h

30.name: (NOT A VECTOR!) - DOS 1+ - FAR JMP instruction

AX.0000:
DPMI 0.9+ - ALLOCATE LDT DESCRIPTORS
	CX = number of descriptors to allocate
Return: CF clear if successful
	    AX = base selector
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code (DPMI 1.0+) (see #03143)
AX.0001:
DPMI 0.9+ - FREE LDT DESCRIPTOR
	BX = selector to free
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code (DPMI 1.0+) (8022h) (see #03143)
AX.0002:
DPMI 0.9+ - SEGMENT TO DESCRIPTOR
	BX = real mode segment
Return: CF clear if successful
	    AX = selector corresponding to real mode segment (64K limit)
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code (DPMI 1.0+) (8011h) (see #03143)
AX.0003:
DPMI 0.9+ - GET NEXT SELECTOR INCREMENT VALUE
Return: CF clear
	    AX = value to add to get next sequential selector
AX.0004:
DPMI 0.9+ - LOCK SELECTOR
	BX = selector to lock (prevent paging)
Return: ???
AX.0005:
DPMI 0.9+ - UNLOCK SELECTOR
	BX = selector to unlock (permit paging)
Return: ???
AX.0006:
DPMI 0.9+ - GET SEGMENT BASE ADDRESS
	BX = selector
Return: CF clear if successful
	    CX:DX = linear base address of segment
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code (DPMI 1.0+) (8022h) (see #03143)
AX.0007:
DPMI 0.9+ - SET SEGMENT BASE ADDRESS
	BX = selector
	CX:DX = linear base address
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code (DPMI 1.0+) (8022h,8025h) (see #03143)
AX.0008:
DPMI 0.9+ - SET SEGMENT LIMIT
	BX = selector
	CX:DX = segment limit
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code (DPMI 1.0+) (8021h,8022h,8025h) (see #03143)
AX.0009:
DPMI 0.9+ - SET DESCRIPTOR ACCESS RIGHTS
	BX = selector
	CL = access rights/type byte (see #00502 at INT 15/AH=89h)
	CH = 80386 extended rights/type byte (see #00505 at INT 15/AH=89h)
	    (32-bit DPMI implementations only)
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code (DPMI 1.0+) (8021h,8022h,8025h) (see #03143)
AX.000A:
DPMI 0.9+ - CREATE ALIAS DESCRIPTOR
	BX = selector
Return: CF clear if successful
	    AX = new data selector
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code (DPMI 1.0+) (8011h,8022h) (see #03143)
AX.000B:
DPMI 0.9+ - GET DESCRIPTOR
	BX = LDT selector
	ES:(E)DI -> 8-byte buffer for copy of descriptor
Return: CF clear if successful
	    buffer filled
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code (DPMI 1.0+) (8022h) (see #03143)
AX.000C:
DPMI 0.9+ - SET DESCRIPTOR
	BX = LDT selector
	ES:(E)DI -> 8-byte buffer containing descriptor
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code (DPMI 1.0+) (8021h,8022h,8025h) (see #03143)
AX.000D:
DPMI 0.9+ - ALLOCATE SPECIFIC LDT DESCRIPTOR
	BX = LDT selector
Return: CF clear if successful
	    descriptor allocated
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code (DPMI 1.0+) (8011h,8022h) (see #03143)
AX.000E:
DPMI 1.0+ - GET MULTIPLE DESCRIPTORS
	CX = number of descriptors to copy
	ES:(E)DI -> descriptor buffer (see #03144)
Return: CF clear if successful
	    descriptors copied
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code (8022h) (see #03143)
	    CX = number of descriptors successfully copied
AX.000F:
DPMI 1.0+ - SET MULTIPLE DESCRIPTORS
	CX = number of descriptors to copy
	ES:(E)DI -> descriptor buffer (see #03145)
Return: CF clear if successful
	    descriptors copied
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code (8021h,8022h,8025h) (see #03143)
	    CX = number of descriptors successfully copied
AX.0100:
DPMI 0.9+ - ALLOCATE DOS MEMORY BLOCK
	BX = number of paragraphs to allocate
Return: CF clear if successful
	    AX = real mode segment of allocated block
	    DX = first selector for allocated block
	CF set on error
	    AX = DOS error code (07h,08h) (see #01680 at INT 21/AH=59h/BX=0000h)
		(DPMI 1.0+) DPMI error code (8011h) (see #03143)
	    BX = size (in paragraphs) of largest available block
AX.0101:
DPMI 0.9+ - FREE DOS MEMORY BLOCK
	DX = selector of block
Return: CF set if successful
	CF set on error
	    AX = DOS error code (07h,09h) (see #01680 at INT 21/AH=59h/BX=0000h)
AX.0102:
DPMI 0.9+ - RESIZE DOS MEMORY BLOCK
	BX = new block size in paragraphs
	DX = selector of block
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
	    AX = DOS error code (07h,08h,09h)
		  (see #01680 at INT 21/AH=59h/BX=0000h)
		(DPMI 1.0+) DPMI error code (8011h,8022h) (see #03143)
	    BX = maximum block size (in paragraphs) possible
AX.0200:
DPMI 0.9+ - GET REAL MODE INTERRUPT VECTOR
	BL = interrupt number
Return: CF clear
	CX:DX = segment:offset of real mode interrupt handler
AX.0201:
DPMI 0.9+ - SET REAL MODE INTERRUPT VECTOR
	BL = interrupt number
	CX:DX = segment:offset of real mode handler
Return: CF clear
AX.0202:
DPMI 0.9+ - GET PROCESSOR EXCEPTION HANDLER VECTOR
	BL = exception number (00h-1Fh)
Return: CF clear if successful
	    CX:(E)DX = selector:offset of handler
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code (DPMI 1.0+) (8021h) (see #03143)
AX.0203:
DPMI 0.9+ - SET PROCESSOR EXCEPTION HANDLER VECTOR
	BL = exception number (00h-1Fh)
	CX:(E)DX = selector:offset of handler
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code (DPMI 1.0+) (8021h,8022h) (see #03143)
AX.0204:
DPMI 0.9+ - GET PROTECTED MODE INTERRUPT VECTOR
	BL = interrupt number
Return: CF clear
	CX:(E)DX = selector:offset of handler
AX.0205:
DPMI 0.9+ - SET PROTECTED MODE INTERRUPT VECTOR
	BL = interrupt number
	CX:(E)DX = selector:offset of handler
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code (DPMI 1.0+) (8022h) (see #03143)
AX.0210:
DPMI 1.0+ - GET PROTECTED MODE EXTENDED PROCESSOR EXCEPTION HANDLER
	BL = exception number (00h-1Fh)
Return: CF clear if successful
	    CX:(E)DX = selector:offset of exception handler
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code (8021h) (see #03143)
AX.0211:
DPMI 1.0+ - GET REAL MODE EXTENDED PROCESSOR EXCEPTION HANDLER
	BL = exception number (00h-1Fh)
Return: CF clear if successful
	    CX:(E)DX = selector:offset of exception handler
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code (8021h) (see #03143)
AX.0212:
DPMI 1.0+ - SET PROTECTED MODE EXTENDED PROCESSOR EXCEPTION HANDLER
	BL = exception or fault number (00h-1Fh)
	CX:(E)DX = exception handler selector:offset
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code (8021h,8022h) (see #03143)
AX.0213:
DPMI 1.0+ - SET REAL MODE EXTENDED PROCESSOR EXCEPTION HANDLER
	BL = exception or fault number (00h-1Fh)
	CX:(E)DX = exception handler selector:offset
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code (8021h,8022h) (see #03143)
AX.0300:
DPMI 0.9+ - SIMULATE REAL MODE INTERRUPT
	BL = interrupt number
	BH = flags
	    bit 0: reset the interrupt controller and A20 line (DPMI 0.9)
		    reserved, must be 0 (DPMI 1.0+)
	    others: reserved, must be 0
	CX = number of words to copy from protected mode to real mode stack
	ES:(E)DI = selector:offset of real mode call structure (see #03148)
Return: CF clear if successful
	    real mode call structure modified (all fields except SS:SP, CS:IP
	      filled with return values from real mode interrupt)
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code (DPMI 1.0+) (8012h,8013h,8014h,8021h)(see #03143)
	protected mode stack unchanged
AX.0301:
DPMI 0.9+ - CALL REAL MODE PROCEDURE WITH FAR RETURN FRAME
	BH = flags
	    bit 0: reset the interrupt controller and A20 line (DPMI 0.9)
		    reserved, must be 0 (DPMI 1.0+)
	    others: reserved must be 0
	CX = number of words to copy from protected mode to real mode stack
	ES:(E)DI = selector:offset of real mode call structure
		  (see #03148 at INT 31/AX=0300h)
Return: CF clear if successful
	    real mode call structure modified (all fields except SS:SP, CS:IP
	      filled with return values from real mode interrupt)
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code (DPMI 1.0+) (8012h,8013h,8014h,8021h)(see #03143)
	protected mode stack unchanged
AX.0302:
DPMI 0.9+ - CALL REAL MODE PROCEDURE WITH IRET FRAME
	BH = flags
	    bit 0: reset the interrupt controller and A20 line (DPMI 0.9)
		    reserved, must be 0 (DPMI 1.0+)
	    others: reserved, must be 0
	CX = number of words to copy from protected mode to real mode stack
	ES:(E)DI = selector:offset of real mode call structure
		  (see #03148 at INT 31/AX=0300h)
Return: CF clear if successful
	    real mode call structure modified (all fields except SS:SP, CS:IP
	      filled with return values from real mode interrupt)
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code (DPMI 1.0+) (8012h,8013h,8014h,8021h)(see #03143)
	protected mode stack unchanged
AX.0303:
DPMI 0.9+ - ALLOCATE REAL MODE CALLBACK ADDRESS
	DS:(E)SI = selector:offset of procedure to call
	ES:(E)DI = selector:offset of real mode call structure (see #03148)
Return: CF clear if successful
	    CX:DX = segment:offset of real mode call address (see #03149)
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code (DPMI 1.0+) (8015h) (see #03143)
AX.0304:
DPMI 0.9+ - FREE REAL MODE CALLBACK ADDRESS
	CX:DX = real mode callback address
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code (DPMI 1.0+) (8024h) (see #03143)
AX.0305:
DPMI 0.9+ - GET STATE SAVE/RESTORE ADDRESSES
Return: CF clear
	AX = size in bytes of state buffer
	BX:CX = real mode address of procedure to save/restore state
	SI:(E)DI = protected mode procedure to save/restore state (see #03150)
AX.0306:
DPMI 0.9+ - GET RAW MODE SWITCH ADDRESSES
Return: CF clear
	BX:CX -> procedure to switch from real to protected mode (see #03151)
	SI:(E)DI -> procedure to switch from protected to real mode
AX.0400:
DPMI 0.9+ - GET DPMI VERSION
Return: CF clear
	AH = major version of DPMI spec supported
	AL = two-digit minor version of DPMI spec supported
	BX = DPMI host flags (see #03152)
	CL = processor type (02h=80286, 03h=80386, 04h=80486)
	DH = curr value of virtual master interrupt controller base interrupt
	DL = curr value of virtual slave interrupt controller base interrupt
AX.0401:
DPMI 1.0+ - GET DPMI CAPABILITIES
	ES:(E)DI -> 128-byte buffer for host description (see #03153)
Return: CF clear if successful
	    AX = capabilities (see #03154)
	    CX = reserved (00h)
	    DX = reserved (00h)
	    buffer filled
	CF set on error (DPMI 0.9 only)
AX.0500:
DPMI 0.9+ - GET FREE MEMORY INFORMATION
	ES:(E)DI -> buffer for memory information (see #03155)
Return: CF clear
AX.0501:
DPMI 0.9+ - ALLOCATE MEMORY BLOCK
	BX:CX = size in bytes
Return: CF clear if successful
	    BX:CX = linear address of block
	    SI:DI = memory block handle for resizing and freeing block
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code (DPMI 1.0+) (8012h-8014h,8016h,8021h)(see #03143)
AX.0502:
DPMI 0.9+ - FREE MEMORY BLOCK
	SI:DI = handle of memory block
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code (DPMI 1.0+) (8023h) (see #03143)
AX.0503:
DPMI 0.9+ - RESIZE MEMORY BLOCK
	BX:CX = new size in bytes (nonzero)
	SI:DI = handle of memory block
Return: CF clear if successful
	    BX:CX = new linear address
	    SI:DI = new handle of memory block
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code (DPMI 1.0+) (8012h-8014h,8016h,8021h,8023h)
		(see #03143)
AX.0504:
DPMI 1.0+ - ALLOCATE LINEAR MEMORY BLOCK
	EBX = page-aligned linear address of memory block (00000000h if any
	      address is acceptable)
	ECX = size in bytes (nonzero)
	EDX = flags
	    bit 0: set to create committed pages instead of uncommitted pages
	    bits 1-31 reserved (0)
Return: CF clear if successful
	    EBX = linear address of memory block
	    ESI = memory block handle
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code (8001h,8012h-8014h,8016h,8021h,8025h)(see #03143)
AX.0505:
DPMI 1.0+ - RESIZE LINEAR MEMORY BLOCK
	ESI = memory block handle
	ECX = new size in bytes (nonzero)
	EDX = flags
	    bit 0: create committed pages rather than uncommitted pages
	    bit 1: segment descriptor update required
		ES:EBX -> buffer containing array of WORDs with selectors
		EDI = number of selectors in array
	    bits 2-31 reserved (0)
Return: CF clear if successful
	    EBX = new linear base address
	    ESI = new memory block handle
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code (8001h,8012h-8014h,8016h,8021h,8023h)(see #03143)
AX.0506:
DPMI 1.0+ - GET PAGE ATTRIBUTES
	ESI = memory block handle
	EBX = offset in memory block of first page
	ECX = number of pages
	ES:EDX -> array of WORDs to hold page attributes (see #03156)
Return: CF clear if successful
	    buffer filled
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code (8001h,8023h,8025h) (see #03143)
AX.0507:
DPMI 1.0+ - MODIFY PAGE ATTRIBUTES
	ESI = memory block handle
	EBX = offset in memory block of first page
	ECX = number of pages
	ES:EDX -> array of WORDs with new page attributes (see #03156)
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code (8001h,8002h,8013h,8014h,8021h,8023h,8025h)
		(see #03143)
	    ECX = number of pages which have been set
AX.0508:
DPMI 1.0+ - MAP DEVICE IN MEMORY BLOCK
	ESI = memory block handle
	EBX = page-aligned offset within memory block of page(s) to be mapped
	ECX = number of pages to map
	EDX = page-aligned physical address of device
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code (8001h,8003h,8023h,8025h) (see #03143)
AX.0509:
DPMI 1.0+ - MAP CONVENTIONAL MEMORY IN MEMORY BLOCK
	ESI = memory block handle
	EBX = page-aligned offset within memory block of page(s) to map
	ECX = number of pages to map
	EDX = page-aligned linear address of conventional (below 1M) memory
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code (8001h,8003h,8023h,8025h) (see #03143)
AX.050A:
DPMI 1.0+ - GET MEMORY BLOCK SIZE AND BASE
	SI:DI = memory block handle
Return: CF clear if successful
	    SI:DI = size in bytes
	    BX:CX = base address
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code (8023h) (see #03143)
AX.050B:
DPMI 1.0+ - GET MEMORY INFORMATION
	ES:(E)DI -> 128-byte buffer for memory information (see #03157)
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error (DPMI 0.9 only)
AX.0600:
DPMI 0.9+ - LOCK LINEAR REGION
	BX:CX = starting linear address
	SI:DI = size of region in bytes
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
	    none of the memory is locked
	    AX = error code (DPMI 1.0+) (8013h,8017h,8025h) (see #03143)
AX.0601:
DPMI 0.9+ - UNLOCK LINEAR REGION
	BX:CX = starting linear address
	SI:DI = size of region in bytes
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
	    none of the memory is unlocked
	    AX = error code (DPMI 1.0+) (8002h,8025h) (see #03143)
AX.0602:
DPMI 0.9+ - MARK REAL MODE REGION AS PAGEABLE
	BX:CX = starting linear address
	SI:DI = size of region in bytes
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
	    none of the memory is made pageable
	    AX = error code (DPMI 1.0+) (8002h,8025h) (see #03143)
AX.0603:
DPMI 0.9+ - RELOCK REAL MODE REGION
	BX:CX = starting linear address
	SI:DI = size of region in bytes
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
	    none of the memory is relocked
	    AX = error code (DPMI 1.0+) (8002h,8013h,8025h) (see #03143)
AX.0604:
DPMI 0.9+ - GET PAGE SIZE
Return: CF clear if successful
	    BX:CX = page size in bytes
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code (DPMI 1.0+) (see also #03143)
		8001h unsupported, 16-bit host
AX.0700:
DPMI 0.9+ - MARK PAGES AS PAGING CANDIDATES
	BX:CX = starting linear page number
	SI:DI = number of pages to mark as paging candidates
Return: ???
AX.0701:
DPMI 0.9+ - DISCARD PAGES
	BX:CX = starting linear page number
	SI:DI = number of pages to discard
Return: ???
AX.0702:
DPMI 0.9+ - MARK PAGE AS DEMAND PAGING CANDIDATE
	BX:CX = starting linear address
	SI:DI = number of bytes to mark as paging candidates
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code (DPMI 1.0+) (8025h) (see #03143)
AX.0703:
DPMI 0.9+ - DISCARD PAGE CONTENTS
	BX:CX = starting linear address
	SI:DI = number of bytes to mark as discarded
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code (DPMI 1.0+) (8025h) (see #03143)
AX.0800:
DPMI 0.9+ - PHYSICAL ADDRESS MAPPING
	BX:CX = physical address (should be above 1 MB)
	SI:DI = size in bytes
Return: CF clear if successful
	    BX:CX = linear address which maps the requested physical memory
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code (DPMI 1.0+) (8003h,8021h) (see #03143)
AX.0801:
DPMI 1.0+ - FREE PHYSICAL ADDRESS MAPPING
	BX:CX = linear address returned by AX=0800h
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code (8025h) (see #03143)
AX.0900:
DPMI 0.9+ - GET AND DISABLE VIRTUAL INTERRUPT STATE
Return: CF clear
	virtual interrupts disabled
	AL = previous interrupt state (00h disabled, 01h enabled)
	AH preserved
AX.0901:
DPMI 0.9+ - GET AND ENABLE VIRTUAL INTERRUPT STATE
Return: CF clear
	virtual interrupts enabled
	AL = previous interrupt state (00h disabled, 01h enabled)
	AH preserved
AX.0902:
DPMI 0.9+ - GET VIRTUAL INTERRUPT STATE
Return: CF clear
	AL = current interrupt state (00h disabled, 01h enabled)
AX.0A00:
DPMI 0.9+ - GET VENDOR SPECIFIC API ENTRY POINT
	DS:(E)SI -> case-sensitive ASCIZ vendor name or identifier
Return: CF clear if successful
	    ES:(E)DI -> FAR extended API entry point
	    DS, FS, GS, EAX, EBX, ECX, EDX, ESI, EBP destroyed
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code (DPMI 1.0+) (8001h) (see #03143)
AX.0B00:
DPMI 0.9+ - SET DEBUG WATCHPOINT
	BX:CX = linear address
	DL = size (1,2,4 bytes)
	DH = type (00h execute, 01h write, 02h read/write)
Return: CF clear if successful
	    BX = watchpoint handle
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code (DPMI 1.0+) (8016h,8021h,8025h) (see #03143)
AX.0B01:
DPMI 0.9+ - CLEAR DEBUG WATCHPOINT
	BX = watchpoint handle
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code (DPMI 1.0+) (8023h) (see #03143)
AX.0B02:
DPMI 0.9+ - GET STATE OF DEBUG WATCHPOINT
	BX = watchpoint handle
Return: CF clear if successful
	    AX = status flags
		bit 0: watch point has been executed since AX=0B00h or AX=0B03h
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code (DPMI 1.0+) (8023h) (see #03143)
AX.0B03:
DPMI 0.9+ - RESET DEBUG WATCHPOINT
	BX = watchpoint handle
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code (DPMI 1.0+) (8023h) (see #03143)
AX.0C00:
DPMI 1.0+ - INSTALL RESIDENT HANDLER INIT CALLBACK
	ES:(E)DI -> resident service provider structure (see #03158)
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code (8015h,8021h,8025h) (see #03143 at AX=0000h)
AX.0C01:
DPMI 1.0+ - TERMINATE AND STAY RESIDENT
	BL = return code
	DX = number of paragraphs of DOS memory to reserve (0 or >= 6)
Return: never
AX.0D00:
DPMI 1.0+ - ALLOCATE SHARED MEMORY
	ES:(E)DI -> shared memory allocation request structure (see #03159)
Return: CF clear if successful
	    request structure updated
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code (8012h,8013h,8014h,8016h,8021h) (see #03143)
AX.0D01:
DPMI 1.0+ - FREE SHARED MEMORY
	SI:DI = shared memory block handle
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code (8023h) (see #03143)
AX.0D02:
DPMI 1.0+ - SERIALIZE SHARED MEMORY
	SI:DI = shared memory block handle
	DX = flags
	    bit 0: return immediately rather than suspending if serialization
		  unavailable
	    bit 1: shared rather than exclusive serialization
	    bits 2-15 reserved (0)
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code (8004h,8005h,8017h-8019h,8023h) (see #03143)
AX.0D03:
DPMI 1.0+ - FREE SERIALIZATION ON SHARED MEMORY
	SI:DI = shared memory block handle
	DX = flags
	    bit 0: release shared serialization rather than exclusive serialztn
	    bit 1: free pending serialization
	    bits 2-15 reserved (0)
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code (8002h,8023h) (see #03143 at AX=0000h)
AX.0E00:
DPMI 1.0+ - GET COPROCESSOR STATUS
Return: CF clear
	AX = coprocessor status (see #03160)
AX.0E01:
DPMI 1.0+ - SET EMULATION
	BX = coprocessor flag bits (see #03161)
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code (8026h) (see #03143 at AX=0000h)
AX.5702:
Netroom3 DPMI.EXE v3.00 - SWITCH TO PROTECTED MODE
	DX = PSP segment of caller
	STACK: WORD	???
	       WORD	flags (bit 0 set if 32-bit program)
Return: as for DPMI mode-switch entry point (see #02718 at INT 2F/AX=1687h)
AX.EE00:
DOS32 v3.0+ - GET DOS32 VERSION AND SELECTOR VALUES
Return: AL = minor version (BCD)
	AH = major version (BCD)
	DL = system type (1=raw DOS, 2=XMS, 4=VCPI, 8=DPMI)
	BX = selector of 4GB data segment with zero base address
AX.EE02:
DOS32 v3.0+ - GET DOS32 ADDRESS INFORMATION
Return: AX = real-mode segment of temporary 8K buffer (v3.1+)
	EBX = 32bit linear address of the program segment
	EDX = Total size in bytes of the programs .EXE file after linking.
	ESI = offset address of PSP
	EDI = offset address of program environment
	ECX = offset address of the program's .EXE ASCIZ file name and path
AX.EE10:
DOS32 v3.2+ - SET UP A DOS32 LOADABLE LIBRARY
	EDX -> library ASCIZ path\filename
	EBX = number of bytes to seek from beginning of file
Return: CF clear if successful
	    EAX = size of memory block required to store library
	    EBX = size of library file
	CF set on error
	    AL = error code.
		01h error opening or reading file
		02h bad DOS32 library file
AX.EE11:
DOS32 v3.2+ - LOAD LIBRARY FILE
	EDX -> near pointer of memory block to store library
Return: CF clear if successful
	    EDX = near pointer to the dynamic library public
	CF set on error
AX.EE20:
DOS32 v3.0+ - GET REAL MODE CALL BACK ADDRESS WITH RETF STACK FRAME
	ESI = offset of the real mode call back function
Return: CF clear if successful
	    CX:DX = real mode address to call up to the protected mode
		  procedure
	CF set on error
AX.EE21:
DOS32 v3.0+ - GET REAL MODE CALL BACK ADDRESS WITH IRET STACK FRAME
	ESI = offset of the real mode call back function
Return: CF clear if successful
	    CX:DX = real mode address to call up to the protected mode
		  procedure
	CF set on error
AX.EE30: DOS32 v3.0+ - TERMINATE AND STAY RESIDENT
AX.EE40:
DOS32 v3.0+ - UNDO PREVIOUS MEMORY ALLOCATION or DMA BUFFER
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
AX.EE41:
DOS32 v3.0+ - ALLOCATE 16KB DMA BLOCK
Return: CF clear if successful
	    EBX -> 16KB DMA block (physical address)
	    EDX -> 16KB DMA block (offset address)
	CF set on error
AX.EE42:
DOS32 v3.0+ - ALLOCATE MEMORY BLOCK
	EDX = size in bytes
Return: CF clear if successful
	    EAX = size in bytes
	    EDX -> memory block
	CF set on error
AX.FF00:
CauseWay - "Info" - GET SYSTEM SELECTORS/FLAGS
Return: AX = selector for flag address space (base 00000000h, limit 4GB)
	BX = selector for current PSP segment (limit 0100h)
	(E)CX = size of DOS transfer buffer (max 64K)
	DX = real-mode segment address of DOS transfer buffer
	ES:(E)SI = protected-mode address of DOS transfer buffer
	EDI = system flags (see #03162)
AX.FF01:
CauseWay - "IntXX" - SIMULATE REAL-MODE INTERRUPT
	BL = interrupt number
	ES:(E)DI -> real-mode register list (see #03148 at AX=0300h)
Return: register list updated
AX.FF02:
CauseWay - "FarCallReal" - SIMULATE REAL-MODE FAR CALL
	ES:(E)DI -> real-mode register list (see #03148 at AX=0300h)
Return: register list updated
AX.FF03:
CauseWay - "GetSel" - ALLOCATE NEW SELECTOR
Return: CF clear if successful
	    BX = new selector
	CF set on error
AX.FF04:
CauseWay - "RelSel" - RELEASE A SELECTOR
	BX = selector
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
AX.FF05:
CauseWay - "CodeSel" - CONVERT SELECTOR TO EXECUTABLE CODE SELECTOR
	BX = selector
	CL = default operation size (00h = 16-bit, 01h = 32-bit)
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
AX.FF06:
CauseWay - "AliasSel" - CREATE READ/WRITE DATA ALIAS SELECTOR
	BX = original selector
Return: CF clear if successful
	    AX = new data selector aliasing original selector
	CF set on error
AX.FF07:
CauseWay - "GetSelDet" - GET SELECTOR BASE AND LIMIT
	BX = selector
Return: CF clear if successful
	    CX:DX = base address
	    SI:DI = limit (bytes)
	CF set on error
AX.FF08:
CauseWay - "GetSelDet32" - GET SELECTOR BASE AND LIMIT (32-bit)
Return: CF clear if successful
	    EDX = base address
	    ECX = limit (bytes)
	CF set on error
AX.FF09:
CauseWay - "SetSelDet" - SET SELECTOR BASE AND LIMIT
	BX = selector
	CX:DX = new base address
	SI:DI = new byte-granular limit
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
AX.FF0A:
CauseWay - "SetSelDet32" - SET SELECTOR BASE AND LIMIT (32-bit)
	BX = selector
	EDX = new base address
	ECX = new byte-granular limit
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
AX.FF0B:
CauseWay - "GetMem" - ALLOCATE BLOCK OF MEMORY
	CX:DX = size in bytes (FFFFh:FFFFh to get size of largest available)
Return: CF clear if successful
	    BX = selector for accessing block if requested size not FFFFh:FFFFh
	    CX:DX = size of largest available block if requested FFFFh:FFFFh
	CF set on error
AX.FF0C:
CauseWay - "GetMem32" - ALLOCATE BLOCK OF MEMORY (32-bit)
	ECX = size in bytes (FFFFFFFFh to get size of largest available block)
Return: CF clear if successful
	    BX = selector for accessing block if requested size not FFFFh:FFFFh
	    ECX = size of largest available block if requested FFFFh:FFFFh
	CF set on error
AX.FF0D:
CauseWay - "ResMem" - RESIZE MEMORY BLOCK
	BX = selector for block to be resized
	CX:DX = new size in bytes
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
AX.FF0E:
CauseWay - "ResMem32" - RESIZE MEMORY BLOCK (32-bit)
	BX = selector for block to be resized
	ECX = new size in bytes
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
AX.FF0F:
CauseWay - "RelMem" - RELEASE PREVIOUSLY ALLOCATED MEMORY
	BX = selector for block to be released
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
AX.FF10:
CauseWay - "GetMemLinear" - ALLOCATE MEMORY WITHOUT SELECTOR
	CX:DX = size of block in bytes
Return: CF clear if successful
	    SI:DI = linear address of allocated block
	CF set on error
AX.FF11:
CauseWay - "GetMemLinear32" - ALLOCATE MEMORY WITHOUT SELECTOR
	ECX = size of block in bytes
Return: CF clear if successful
	    ESI = linear address of allocated block
	CF set on error
AX.FF12:
CauseWay - "ResMemLinear" - RESIZE LINEAR MEMORY BLOCK
	CX:DX = new size in bytes
	SI:DI = linear address of block to be resized
Return: CF clear if successful
	   SI:DI = new linear address of block
	CF set on error
AX.FF13:
CauseWay - "ResMemLinear32" - RESIZE LINEAR MEMORY BLOCK (32-bit)
	ECX = new size in bytes
	ESI = linear address of block to be resized
Return: CF clear if successful
	   ESI = new linear address of block
	CF set on error
AX.FF14:
CauseWay - "RelMemLinear" - RELEASE LINEAR MEMORY BLOCK
	SI:DI = linear address of block to be released
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
AX.FF15:
CauseWay - "RelMemLinear32" - RELEASE LINEAR MEMORY BLOCK (32-bit)
	ESI = linear address of block to be released
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
AX.FF16:
CauseWay - "GetMemNear" - ALLOCATE APPLICATION-RELATIVE MEMORY
	EBX = size in bytes of block to allocate
Return: CF clear if successful
	   ESI = application-relative linear address of allocated block
	CF set on error
AX.FF17:
CauseWay - "ResMemNear" - RESIZE APPLICATION-RELATIVE MEMORY BLOCK
	EBX = size in bytes of block to allocate
	ESI = application-relative linear address of block
Return: CF clear if successful
	    ESI = new application-relative linear address of block
	CF set on error
AX.FF18:
CauseWay - "RelMemNear" - RELEASE APPLICATION-RELATIVE MEMORY BLOCK
	ESI = application-relative linear address of block
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
AX.FF19:
CauseWay - "Linear2Near" - CONVERT LINEAR TO APP-RELATIVE ADDRESS
	ESI = linear address
Return: ESI = application-relative linear address
AX.FF1A:
CauseWay - "Near2Linear" - CONVERT APP-RELATIVE TO LINEAR ADDRESS
	ESI = application-relative linear address
Return: ESI = linear address
AX.FF1B:
CauseWay - "LockMem" - LOCK REGION OF MEMORY
	BX:CX = starting linear address
	SI:DI = size of region in bytes
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
AX.FF1C:
CauseWay - "LockMem32" - LOCK REGION OF MEMORY (32-bit)
	ESI = starting linear address
	ECX = size of region in bytes
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
AX.FF1D:
CauseWay - "UnLockMem" - UNLOCK REGION OF MEMORY
	BX:CX = starting linear address
	SI:DI = size of region in bytes
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
AX.FF1E:
CauseWay - "UnLockMem32" - UNLOCK REGION OF MEMORY (32-bit)
	ESI = starting linear address
	ECX = size of region in bytes
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
AX.FF1F:
CauseWay - "LockMemNear" - LOCK APPLICATION-RELATIVE MEMORY REGION
	ESI = starting application-relative linear address
	EBX = size of region in bytes
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
AX.FF20:
CauseWay - "UnLockMemNear" - UNLOCK APP-RELATIVE MEMORY REGION
	ESI = starting application-relative linear address
	ECX = size of region in bytes
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
AX.FF21:
CauseWay - "GetMemDOS" - ALLOCATE CONVENTIONAL MEMORY
	BX = number of paragraphs to allocate
Return: CF clear if successful
	    AX = real-mode segment of allocated block
	    DX = initial selector for block
	CF set on error
	    AX = DOS error code (see #01680 at INT 21/AH=59h/BX=0000h)
	    BX = size of largest available block
AX.FF22:
CauseWay - "ResMemDOS" - RESIZE CONVENTIONAL MEMORY BLOCK
	BX = new size in paragraphs
	DX = initial selector for block
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
	    AX = DOS error code (see #01680 at INT 21/AH=59h/BX=0000h)
	    BX = maximum number of paragraphs available
AX.FF23:
CauseWay - "RelMemDOS" - RELEASE CONVENTIONAL MEMORY BLOCK
	DX = initial selector for block
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
	    AX = DOS error code (see #01680 at INT 21/AH=59h/BX=0000h)
AX.FF24:
CauseWay - "ExecOverlay" - LOAD AND OPTIONALLY EXECUTE APP CODE
	EBX = flags
	    bit 0: don't execute (overlay only)
	    bit 1: don't preserve relocation information
	ES:EDX -> filename (see also #03163)
	FS:ESI -> commandline (ESI = 00000000h if no commandline)
	GS:EDI -> name (CW's /o option)
Return: CF clear if successful
	    ---EBX bit 0 set---
	    CX:EDX = program entry point (CS:EIP)
	    SI = segment of PSP
	    ---EBX bit 1 set---
	    BX:EAX = initial SS:ESP
	    EDI high word = base segment
	    EDI low word = number of segments
	    EBP = start of segment definitions
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code
		0001h DOS file access error
		0002h not a CuaseWay 3P file
		0003h not enough memory
AX.FF25:
CauseWay - "GetDOSTrans" - GET DOS TRANSFER BUFFER
Return: BX = real-mode segment of transfer buffer
	ECX = transfer buffer size
	DX = protected-mode selector for transfer buffer
AX.FF26:
CauseWay - "SetDOSTrans" - SET DOS TRANSFER BUFFER
	BX = real-mode segment of new transfer buffer
	ECX = new transfer buffer size
	DX = protected-mode selector for new transfer buffer
Return: nothing
AX.FF27:
CauseWay v1.3 - "GetMCBSize" - GET CURRENT MCB ALLOCATION BLOCK SIZE
Return: ECX = current threshold
AX.FF28:
CauseWay v1.3 - "SetMCBSize" - SET MCB MEMORY ALLOCATION BLOCK SIZE
	ECX = new threshold (0000000h to disable MCB memory allocation system)
Return: CF clear if successful
	    threshold unchanged (default 16K)
	CF set on error (threshold > 64K)
AX.FF29:
CauseWay v1.3 - "GetSels" - ALLOCATE MULTIPLE SELECTORS
	CX = number of selectors to allocate
Return: BX = base selector
AX.FF2A:
CauseWay v1.3 - "cwLoad" - LOAD ANOTHER CAUSEWAY PROGRAM AS OVERLAY
	DS:EDX -> filename
Return: CF clear if successful
	    CX:EDX = CS:EIP of entry point
	    BX:EAX = initial SS:ESP for program
	    SI = PSP for overlay program
	CF set on error
	    AX = error code (01h file error, 02h not a 3P file, 03h no memory)
AX.FF2B:
CauseWay v1.3 - "cwcInfo" - VALIDATE AND GET SIZE OF CWC FILE
	BX = file handle for CWC-compressed file
Return: CF clear if successful
	    ECX = expanded file size
	CF set on error (not a CWC-compressed file)
AX.FF2C:
CauseWay v1.3 - "GetMemSO" - ALLOCATE MEMORY AND RETURN SEL:OFFSET
	CX:DX = block size in bytes
Return: CF clear if successful
	   SI:DI = selector:offset of allocated memory
	CF set on error
AX.FF2D:
CauseWay v1.3 - "ResMemSO" - RESIZE SELECTOR:OFFSET MEMORY BLOCK
	SI:DI = selector:offset for memory block
	CX:DX = new size of block
Return: CF clear if successful
	   SI:DI = new selector:offset for memory block
	CF set on error
AX.FF2E:
CauseWay v1.3 - "RelMemSO" - RELEASE SELECTOR:OFFSET MEMORY BLOCK
	SI:DI = selector:offset for memory block
AX.FFFB:
Causeway v1.3 - "cwcLoad" - LOAD/EXPAND CWC-COMPRESSED FILE
	BX = source file handle
	ES:EDI -> memory buffer into which to expand file
Return: CF clear if successful
	    ECX = expanded data length
	CF set on error
	    EAX = error code (01h file error, 02h bad data, 03h not CWC file)

31.name: overwritten by CP/M jump instruction in INT 30

AH.57:
Netroom3 DPMI.EXE v3.00 - ???
	AL = subfunction (at least 02h,03h,04h,05h,07h,08h,09h,0Ah)
	???
Return: ???

AX.0000:
MS MOUSE - RESET DRIVER AND READ STATUS
Return: AX = status
	    0000h hardware/driver not installed
	    FFFFh hardware/driver installed
	BX = number of buttons
	    0000h other than two
	    0002h two buttons (many drivers)
	    0003h Mouse Systems/Logitech three-button mouse
	    FFFFh two buttons
AX.0001: MS MOUSE v1.0+ - SHOW MOUSE CURSOR
AX.0002: MS MOUSE v1.0+ - HIDE MOUSE CURSOR
AX.0003:
MS MOUSE v1.0+ - RETURN POSITION AND BUTTON STATUS
Return: BX = button status (see #03168)
	CX = column
	DX = row
AX.0004:
MS MOUSE v1.0+ - POSITION MOUSE CURSOR
	CX = column
	DX = row
AX.0005:
MS MOUSE v1.0+ - RETURN BUTTON PRESS DATA
	BX = button number (see #03169)
Return: AX = button states (see #03168)
	BX = number of times specified button has been pressed since last call
	CX = column at time specified button was last pressed

	DH,DL = source start column,row
	BH,BL = destination start column,row
	CH = width of region to move/copy
	CL = height of region to move/copy
Return: nothing
AH.08:
TI Professional PC - CRT - GET CHARACTER AND ATTRIBUTE AT POSITION
Return: AL = character at current cursor position
	AH = attribute
AH.09:
TI Professional PC - CRT - WRITE CHARACTER(S) WITH ATTRIBUTE
	AL = character to write
	BL = attribute to use (becomes new current attribute)
	CX = number of times to write character
Return: nothing
AH.0A:
TI Professional PC - CRT - WRITE CHARACTER(S) WITH CURRENT ATTRIBUTE
	AL = character to write
	CX = number of times to write character
Return: nothing
AH.0E:
TI Professional PC - CRT - TTY OUTPUT
	AL = character to write
Return: nothing
AH.10:
TI Professional PC - CRT - WRITE BLOCK OF CHARACTERS WITH ATTRIBUTE
	AL = attribute (becomes new current attribute)
	DX:BX -> string of characters to write
	CX = length of string
Return: nothing
AH.11:
TI Professional PC - CRT - WRITE BLOCK OF CHARACTERS WITH CURR ATTRIB
	DX:BX -> string of characters to write
	CX = length of string
Return: nothing
AH.12:
TI Professional PC - CRT - FILL ENTIRE SCREEN WITH ATTRIBUTE
	AL = attribute (see #03210)
Return: nothing
AH.13:
TI Professional PC - CRT - CLEAR ENTIRE TEXT SCREEN AND HOME CURSOR
Return: nothing
AH.14:
TI Professional PC - CRT - CLEAR ENTIRE GRAPHICS SCREEN
Return: nothing
AH.15:
TI Professional PC - CRT - SET PROTECTED STATUS AREA
	CL = row at which to start status area, or 00h to cancel
	CH = 00h
Return: nothing
AH.16:
TI Professional PC - CRT - SET ATTRIBUTE LATCH
	BL = new attribute (see #03210)
Return: nothing
AH.17:
TI Professional PC - CRT - GET START-OF-DISPLAY POINTER
Return: DX = current offset at which display starts
AH.18:
TI Professional PC - CRT - PRINT TTY STRING
	CS:BX -> counted string (count byte with length followed by string)
Return: nothing

4B.name: IBM SCSI interface; Virtual DMA Specification (VDS)

AH.00:
TI Professional PC - DISK - RESET DISK SYSTEM
	DL = drive (if bit 7 is set both hard disks and floppy disks reset)
Return: AH = status (see #00234 at INT 13/AH=01h)
	CF clear if successful (returned AH=00h)
	CF set on error
AH.01:
TI Professional PC - DISK - GET STATUS OF LAST OPERATION
	DL = drive (bit 7 set for hard disk)
Return: CF clear if status unchanged
	CF set if status changed since last call
	AH = 00h
	AL = status of previous operation (see #00234 at INT 13/AH=01h)
AH.02:
TI Professional PC - DISK - READ SECTOR(S) INTO MEMORY
	AL = number of sectors to read (must be nonzero)
	CH = low eight bits of cylinder number
	CL = sector number 1-63 (bits 0-5)
	     high two bits of cylinder (bits 6-7, hard disk only)
	DH = head number
	DL = drive number (bit 7 set for hard disk)
	ES:BX -> data buffer
Return: CF set on error
	    if AH = 11h (corrected ECC error), AL = burst length
	CF clear if successful
	AH = status (see #00234 at INT 13/AH=01h)
	AL = number of sectors transferred
	ES:BX -> buffer for last sector processed (including one with errors)
AH.03:
TI Professional PC - DISK - WRITE SECTOR(S) FROM MEMORY
	AL = number of sectors to write (must be nonzero)
	CH = low eight bits of cylinder number
	CL = sector number 1-63 (bits 0-5)
	     high two bits of cylinder (bits 6-7, hard disk only)
	DH = head number
	DL = drive number (bit 7 set for hard disk)
	ES:BX -> buffer containing data
Return: CF set on error
	    if AH = 11h (corrected ECC error), AL = burst length
	CF clear if successful
	AH = status (see #00234 at INT 13/AH=01h)
	AL = number of sectors transferred
	ES:BX -> buffer for last sector processed (including one with errors)
AH.04:
TI Professional PC - DISK - VERIFY DISK SECTOR CRC(S)
	AL = number of sectors to verify (must be nonzero)
	CH = low eight bits of cylinder number
	CL = sector number 1-63 (bits 0-5)
	     high two bits of cylinder (bits 6-7, hard disk only)
	DH = head number
	DL = drive number (bit 7 set for hard disk)
	ES:BX -> data buffer
Return: CF set on error
	    if AH = 11h (corrected ECC error), AL = burst length
	CF clear if successful
	AH = status (see #00234 at INT 13/AH=01h)
	AL = number of sectors transferred
	ES:BX -> buffer for last sector processed (including one with errors)
AH.06:
TI Professional PC - DISK - VERIFY DISK SECTOR(S)
	AL = number of sectors to verify (must be nonzero)
	CH = low eight bits of cylinder number
	CL = sector number 1-63 (bits 0-5)
	     high two bits of cylinder (bits 6-7, hard disk only)
	DH = head number
	DL = drive number (bit 7 set for hard disk)
	ES:BX -> data buffer
Return: CF set on error
	    if AH = 11h (corrected ECC error), AL = burst length
	CF clear if successful
	AH = status (see #00234 at INT 13/AH=01h)
	AL = number of sectors transferred
	ES:BX -> buffer for last sector processed (including one with errors)
AH.07:
TI Professional PC - DISK - GET RETRY STATUS OF LAST OPERATION
	DL = drive (bit 7 set for hard disk)
Return: CF clear if status unchanged
	CF set if status changed since last call
	AH = 00h
	AL = status of previous operation (see #00234 at INT 13/AH=01h)
AH.08:
TI Professional PC - DISK - SET STANDARD DEVICE INTERFACE TABLE
	DL = drive number (00h-03h)
	AL = drive type
	    00h single-sided 48 tpi (40-track, 8 sectors, 512 bytes/sector)
	    01h double-sided 48 tpi (40-track, 8 sectors, 512 bytes/sector)
	    02h single-sided 96 tpi (80-track, 8 sectors, 512 bytes/sector)
	    03h double-sided 96 tpi (80-track, 8 sectors, 512 bytes/sector)
Return: nothing???
AH.09:
TI Professional PC - DISK - SET DEVICE INTERFACE TABLE ADDRESS
	DL = drive number (00h-07h)
	ES:BX -> Device Interface Table (see #03226)
Return: nothing???
AH.0A:
TI Professional PC - DISK - GET DEVICE INTERFACE TABLE ADDRESS
	DL = drive number (00h-07h)
Return: AH = status
	ES:BX -> Device Interface Table (see #03226)
AH.0B:
TI Professional PC - DISK - TURN OFF ALL DRIVES
Return: AH = 00h

AX.0000:
Vanderaart TEXT WINDOWS, PC Thuis Shell - OPEN TEXT WINDOW
	ES:BX -> name string or ES:0000h if none
	CH,CL = row,column of upper left corner
	DH,DL = row,column of lower right corner
Return: AX = window handle or
	    0000h if not installed
	    FFFFh on error
AX.0001:
Vanderaart TEXT WINDOWS, PC Thuis Shell - CLOSE TEXT WINDOW
	DI = window handle
AX.0002:
Vanderaart TEXT WINDOWS - PUT CHARACTER IN WINDOW
	BL = character
	BH = attribute
	DL = column
	DH = row
	DI = window handle
Return: AX = status
	    0000h if successful
	    FFFFh if outside window
AX.0003:
Vanderaart TEXT WINDOWS - OUTPUT LINE TO WINDOW
	ES:BX -> text string
	CX = string length (0000h if ASCIZ string)
	DL = position (FFh centered, else flush left)
	DH = starting row
	DI = window handle
Return: AX = status
	    0000h successful
	    FFFFh did not fit in window
AX.0004:
Vanderaart TEXT WINDOWS - GET KEY
	CH = type
	    00h any key
	    01h 'J' or 'N' (Dutch for yes/no)
Return: AX = key
AX.0005:
Vanderaart TEXT WINDOWS - CHANGE ATTRIBUTE
	BL = new attribute
	CH,CL = row,column of upper left corner
	DH,DL = row,column of lower right corner
	DI = window handle
AX.0006:
Vanderaart TEXT WINDOWS - EDIT LINE IN WINDOW
	ES:BX -> text string
	CH = type of input (see #03242)
	DH,DL = row,column of upper left corner
	DI = window handle
Return: AX = key which terminated entry
	    0000h Enter
	    0001h Esc
	    0002h Down arrow
	    0003h Up arrow
	    0004h F10

60.name: reserved for user interrupt; multiple purposes

AX.0000:
OPTIMA 1024 VGA-Sync,ET-3000 chipset - ZOOM DISPLAY
	BX = zoom factor (0-7)
AX.0001:
OPTIMA 1024 VGA-Sync,ET-3000 chipset - CENTER ZOOM WINDOW
	BX = X coordinate to center
	CX = Y coordinate to center
AX.0003:
OPTIMA 1024 VGA-Sync,ET-3000 chipset - REPORT ZOOM FACTOR
Return: AX = zoom factor
AX.0004: OPTIMA 1024 VGA-Sync,ET-3000 chipset - ENTER SPECIFY MODE
AX.0005:
OPTIMA 1024 VGA-Sync - QUERY ZOOM WINDOW
	BX:CX -> buffer for window parameters (see #03429)

OPTIMA 1024 VGA-Sync,ET-3000 chipset - SET ZOOM OFFSET
	BX = X start of zoom offset
	CX = Y start of zoom offset

61.name: reserved for user interrupt; multiple purposes

AX.0000:
FGDRIVER v3.03+ - "FG_ALLOCATE" - CREATE VIRTUAL VIDEO PAGE
	BX = page number (0000h-003Fh)
Return: AX = status (0000h,0001h,0007h,0008h) (see #03473)
AX.0001:
FGDRIVER v3.03+ - "FG_ALLOCCMS" - CREATE LOGICAL VIDEO PAGE (CONV)
	BX = page number (0001h-003Fh)
Return: AX = status (0000h,FFFCh,FFFDh,FFFEh) (see #03473)
AX.0002:
FGDRIVER v3.03+ - "FG_ALLOCEMS" - CREATE LOGICAL VIDEO PAGE (EMS)
	BX = page number (0001h-003Fh)
Return: AX = status (0000h,FFFCh,FFFDh,FFFEh) (see #03473)
AX.0003:
FGDRIVER v3.03+ - "FG_ALLOCXMS" - CREATE LOGICAL VIDEO PAGE (XMS)
	BX = page number (0001h-003Fh)
Return: AX = status (0000h,FFFCh,FFFDh,FFFEh) (see #03473)

FGDRIVER 1.10,3.03+ - "FG_AUTOMODE" - GET VIDEO MODE W/MOST FEATURES
Return: AX = proposed video mode number (see #03500 at AX=00B0h)

	BX = horizontal resolution
	CX = vertical resolution

Return: AX = proposed video mode number or FFFFh if no matching video mode

FGDRIVER v3.03+ - "FG_BOX" - DRAW UNFILLED RECTANGLE
	BX = left column
	CX = right column
	DX = top row
	SI = bottom row

FGDRIVER v3.03+ - "FG_BOXDEPTH" - SET RECTANGLE BORDER WIDTH
	BX = width of left and right edges in pixels (> 0)
	CX = width of top and bottom edges in pixels (> 0)
AX.0008:
FGDRIVER v3.03+ - "FG_BOXX" - XOR HOLLOW RECTANGLE

	CX = right column

	SI = bottom row

FGDRIVER v3.03+ - "FG_BUTTON" - GET JOYSTICK BUTTON STATE
	BX = joystick number (0001h or 0002h)
Return: AX = button states
	    bit 0: top button pressed
	    bit 1: bottom button pressed

FGDRIVER v3.03+ - "FG_CAPSLOCK" - GET STATE OF CAPSLOCK KEY
Return: AX = CapsLock state (0000h off, 0001h on)

FGDRIVER v3.03+ - "FG_CHGATTR" - APPLY CURRENT TEXT ATTRIB TO CHARS
	BX = number of characters to recolor

FGDRIVER v3.03+ - "FG_CHGTEXT" - DISPLAY STRING AT CURSOR POSITION

Return: text cursor updated

FGDRIVER v3.03+ - "FG_CIRCLE" - DRAW UNFILLED CIRCLE

AX.000E:
FGDRIVER v3.03+ - "FG_CIRCLEF" - DRAW FILLED CIRCLE

FGDRIVER v4.02 - "FG_CLIPMAP" - DISPLAY CLIPPED IMAGE (MODE-INDEP)

FGDRIVER v4.02 - "FG_CLIPMASK" - DISPLAY CLIPPED IMAGE (MASKING MAP)

	DX = width of masking map in pixels

FGDRIVER v4.02 - "FG_CLPIMAGE" - DISPLAY CLIPPED IMAGE (BITMAP)

FGDRIVER v4.02 - "FG_CLPRECT" - DRAW FILLED RECTANGLE IN SCREEN SPCE
	BX = screen space column of left edge

FGDRIVER v4.02 - "FG_COLORS" - GET SIMULTANEOUSLY-AVAILABLE COLORS
Return: AX = number of colors available at one time
AX.0014:
FGDRIVER v4.02 - "FG_COPYPAGE" - TRANSFER VIDEO PAGE CONTENTS

FGDRIVER v4.02 - "FG_DASH" - DRAW DASHED LINE TO ABSOLUTE POSITION

FGDRIVER v4.02 - "FG_DASHREL" - DRAW DASHED LINE TO RELATVE POSITION

FGDRIVER v4.02 - "FG_DRAW" - DRAW SOLID LINE TO ABSOLUTE POSITION

FGDRIVER v4.02 - "FG_DRAWMAP" - DISPLAY MODE-INDEPENDENT BIT MAP

FGDRIVER v4.02 - "FG_DRAWMASK" - DISPLAY IMAGE (MASKING MAP)

	CX = number of pixel runs in masking map

	BX = desired video mode (00h-17h, also 18h-1Dh after "FG_SVGAINIT")
	CX = required number of video pages (ignore memory size if <= 0)
Return: AX = status
	    0000h mode not available with requested number of pages
	    0001h mode is available
AX.00C8:
FGDRIVER v4.02 - "FG_TEXT" - DISPLAY STRING OF CHARACTERS
	CX = length of string
	ES:BX -> string
AX.00C9:
FGDRIVER v4.02 - "FG_TEXTC" - DISPLAY STRING OF CHARACTERS (CLIPPED)
	CX = length of string
	ES:BX -> string
AX.00CA:
FGDRIVER v4.02 - "FG_TRANSFER" - COPY REGION
	CX = source video page
	DX = destination video page
	ES:BX -> copy record (see #03508)
AX.00CB:
FGDRIVER v4.02 - "FG_UNPACK" - EXPAND MODE-SPECIFIC BITMAP
	ES:BX -> variable pointer record (see #03509)
	CX = size of source bitmap in bytes
Return: result buffer filled
AX.00CC:
FGDRIVER v4.02 - "FG_VBADDR" - GET ADDRESS OF VIRTUAL BUFFER
	BX = virtual buffer handle (0000h-001Fh)
Return: DX:AX -> virtual buffer
AX.00CD:
FGDRIVER v4.02 - "FG_VBALLOC" - CREATE VIRTUAL BUFFER
	BX = width of virtual buffer in pixels
	CX = height in pixels
Return: AX = handle for virtual buffer, or
	    FFFEh out of memory
	    FFFFh virtual buffer table full
AX.00CE: FGDRIVER v4.02 - "FG_VBCLOSE" - CLOSE ACTIVE VIRTUAL BUFFER
AX.00CF:
FGDRIVER v4.02 - "FG_VBCOPY" - COPY RECT BETWEEN VIRTUAL BUFFERS
	ES:BX -> variable record (see #03510)
	CX = handle for source virtual buffer
	DX = handle for destination virtual buffer
AX.00D0:
FGDRIVER v4.02 - "FG_VBCUT" - COPY RECT FROM VIDEO TO VIRTUAL BUFFER
	BX = source region's left edge
	CX = source region's right edge
	DX = source region's top edge
	SI = source region's bottom edge
	DI = X coordinate of destination's upper left corner
	ES = Y coordinate of destination's upper left corner
AX.00D1:
FGDRIVER v4.02 - "FG_VBDEFINE" - CREATE VIRTUAL BUFFER
	ES:BX -> memory block for virtual buffer
	CX = buffer width in pixels
	DX = buffer height in pixels
Return: AX = virtual buffer handle
	    FFFFh on error
AX.00D2:
FGDRIVER v4.02 - "FG_VBFREE" - RELEASE VIRTUAL BUFFER
	BX = virtual buffer handle
AX.00D3:
FGDRIVER v4.02 - "FG_VBHANDLE" - GET ACTIVE VIRTUAL BUFFER'S HANDLE
Return: AX = handle for active virtual buffer
AX.00D4:
FGDRIVER v4.02 - "FG_VBINIT" - INITIALIZE VIRTUAL BUFFER ENVIRONMENT
Return: nothing
AX.00D5:
FGDRIVER v4.02 - "FG_VBOPEN" - MAKE VIRTUAL BUFFER ACTIVE
	BX = virtual buffer handle
Return: AX = status
	    0000h successful
	    FFFEh no buffer defined for specified handle
	    FFFFh invalid buffer handle
AX.00D6:
FGDRIVER v4.02 - "FG_VBPASTE" - COPY RECT FROM VIRTUAL BUF TO VIDEO
	BX = source region's left edge
	CX = source region's right edge
	DX = source region's top edge
	SI = source region's bottom edge
	DI = X coordinate of destination's upper left corner
	ES = Y coordinate of destination's upper left corner
AX.00D7:
FGDRIVER v4.02 - "FG_VBTCCOPY" - COPY RECTANGLE BETWEEN VIRTUAL BUFS
	ES:BX -> variable record (see #03511)
	CX = source virtual buffer's handle
	DX = destination virtual buffer's handle
AX.00D8:
FGDRIVER v4.02 - "FG_VBTCXFER" - COPY RECTANGLE TO ACTIVE VIDEO PAGE
	BX = source region's left edge
	CX = source region's right edge
	DX = source region's top edge
	SI = source region's bottom edge
	DI = X coordinate of destination's upper left corner
	ES = Y coordinate of destination's upper left corner
AX.00D9:
FGDRIVER v4.02 - "FG_VBUNDEF" - RELEASE HANDLE FOR VIRTUAL BUFFER
	BX = virtual buffer handle
AX.00DA:
FGDRIVER v4.02 - "FG_VGASTATE" - SAVE/RESTORE VGA CONTROLLER STATE
	BX = direction (0000h save, else restore)
AX.00DB:
FGDRIVER v4.02 - "FG_VOICE" - START SOUND
	BX = channel on TI sound chip
	    1-3 = channels 1-3, 4 = channel 4 with periodic noise,
	    5 = channel 4 with white noise
	CX = frequency in Hz (18-32767 for channels 1-3; 0=512 Hz, 1=1024 Hz,
	      2=2048 Hz for channels 4 and 5)
	DX = volume
	SI = duration in clock ticks (continuous if <= 0)
AX.00DC:
FGDRIVER v4.02 - "FG_VOICES" - PLAY SOUNDS IN BACKGROUND
	ES:BX -> tone array (see #03512)
	CX = number of times to repeat tone array
AX.00DD:
FGDRIVER v4.02 - "FG_WAITFOR" - DELAY FOR SPECIFIED DURATION
	BX = duration in clock ticks
Return: after delay elapses
AX.00DE:
FGDRIVER v4.02 - "FG_WAITKEY" - FLUSH KEYBOARD BUFFER AND AWAIT KEY
Return: after next key pressed
AX.00DF:
FGDRIVER v4.02 - "FG_WAITVR" - ENABLE/DISABLE VERTICAL RETRACE WAIT
	BX = new state (0000h disabled, 0001h enabled)
AX.00E0:
FGDRIVER v4.02 - "FG_WHERE" - GET CURRENT CURSOR POSITION
	ES:BX -> variable pointers (see #03513)
Return: indicated variables filled with cursor row and column for active
	  display
AX.00E1:
FGDRIVER v4.02 - "FG_XALPHA" - CONVERT SCREEN COLUMN TO CHAR COLUMN
	BX = screen space column
Return: AX = character space column containing specified coordinate
AX.00E2:
FGDRIVER v4.02 - "FG_XCONVERT" - CONVERT CHAR COLUMN TO SCREEN COL
	BX = character space column
Return: AX = screen space column of leftmost pixel in specified character col
AX.00E3:
FGDRIVER v4.02 - "FG_XVIEW" - CONVERT VIEWPORT COORDINATE
	BX = horizontal viewport coordinate
Return: AX = screen space X coordinate corresponding to supplied coordinate
AX.00E4:
FGDRIVER v4.02 - "FG_YALPHA" - CONVERT SCREEN ROW TO CHARACTER ROW
	BX = screen space row
Return: AX = character space row containing specified coordinate
AX.00E5:
FGDRIVER v4.02 - "FG_YCONVERT" - CONVERT CHARACTER ROW TO SCREEN ROW
	BX = character space row
Return: AX = screen space row of topmost pixel in specified character row
AX.00E6:
FGDRIVER v4.02 - "FG_YVIEW" - TRANSLATE VERTICAL VIEWPORT COORDINATE
	BX = viewport Y coordinate
Return: AX = screen space row for viewport coordinate

62.name: reserved for user interrupt; multiple purposes

AH.01: Cswitch - GIVE UP REST OF TIME-SLICE
AH.02:
Cswitch - WAIT FOR SEMAPHORE
	DX = semaphore number (0-63)
Return: AX = FFFFh bad semaphore number
	     else  success
AH.03:
Cswitch - CHECK SEMAPHORE
	DX = semaphore number (0-63)
Return: AX = status
	    FFFFh not owned
	    else  owned
AH.04:
Cswitch - TRIGGER SEMAPHORE
	DX = semaphore number (0-63)
Return: AX = status
	    FFFFh bad semaphore number
	    else  success
AH.05:
Cswitch - SLEEP
	BX = seconds to sleep
AH.07:
Cswitch - SPAWN
	ES:BX -> function address to start executing at
	CX = priority (1-10)
Return: AX = result/status
	    FFFDh  no free memory control blocks
	    FFFEh  no free task control blocks
	    FFFFh  not enough memory to create new task stack
	    >0	   the tcb number of the new task, indicating no error
AH.08:
Cswitch - WAKE UP TASK
	BX = tcb identifier
AH.09:
Cswitch - SET PRIORITY
	BX = new base priority (1-10)
AH.0A:
Cswitch - TEST MESSAGE QUEUE
	DX = queue number (0-63)
Return: AX = result/message size
	    0000h nothing on queue
	    FFFFh bad queue number
	    else  number of bytes in first message in queue
AH.0B:
Cswitch - SEND MESSAGE
	CX = number of bytes to write
	DS:SI -> buffer
	DX = queue number (0-63)
Return: AX = result/message size
	    0000h no message was on queue
	    FFFEh triggered by something arriving, redo the call
	    FFFFh bad queue number
	    else  number of bytes in message
AH.0C:
Cswitch - READ MESSAGE
	CX = number of bytes to read
	DS:SI -> buffer
	DX = queue number (0-63)
Return: AX = status
	    FFFFh bad queue number
	    else  number of bytes transferred
AH.0D: Cswitch - DON'T ALLOW TASK TO BE SWAPPED OUT
AH.0E: Cswitch - ALLOW TASK TO BE SWAPPED OUT
AH.0F:
Cswitch - LOAD AND RUN PROGRAM FROM DISK
	ES:BX -> command line
	CX = priority (1-10)
	DX = background flag (nonzero allows loading to EMS)
Return: AX = status
	    0000h task loader queue is full
	    0001h  no error
AH.11:
Cswitch - GET TCB INFORMATION
	ES:BX -> a pointer which will be set to the tcb address
Return: AX = tcb indentifier
AH.12:
Cswitch - GET TCB ADDRESS
	ES:BX -> a pointer which will be set to the tcb table address
Return: AX = tcb indentifier
AH.13:
Cswitch - CHECK STATUS OF PREVIOUS LOAD_TASK
Return: AX = result
	    FFFCh no Memory Control Blocks available
	    FFFDh no TCBs available
	    FFFEh insufficient memory
	    FFFFh cannot open file
	    0000h load in progress (not done yet)
	    else  tcb indentifier

63.name: reserved for user interrupt; multiple purposes

64.name: reserved for user interrupt; multiple purposes

65.name: reserved for user interrupt; multiple purposes

66.name: reserved for user interrupt; multiple purposes

AX.DE00:
Virtual Control Program Interface - INSTALLATION CHECK
Return: AH = status
	    00h VCPI is present
		BH = major version number
		BL = minor version number
	    nonzero  VCPI not present
AX.DE01:
Virtual Control Program Interface - GET PROTECTED MODE INTERFACE
	ES:DI -> 4K page table buffer
	DS:SI -> three descriptor table entries in GDT
		first becomes code segment descriptor, other two for use by
		  main control program
Return: AH = 00h successful
	    DI -> first unused page table entry in buffer
	    EBX -> protected mode entry point in code segment (see #03664)
	AH = nonzero  failed
AX.DE02:
Virtual Control Program Interface - GET MAX PHYSICAL MEMORY ADDRESS
Return: AH = 00h  successful
	    EDX = physical address of highest 4K memory page
	AH nonzero: failed
AX.DE03:
Virtual Control Program Interface - GET NUMBER OF FREE 4K PAGES
Return: AH = 00h  successful
	    EDX = number of free 4K pages
	AH nonzero: failed
AX.DE04:
Virtual Control Program Interface - ALLOCATE A 4K PAGE
Return: AH = 00h successful
	    EDX = physical address of allocated page
	AH nonzero: failed
AX.DE05:
Virtual Control Program Interface - FREE 4K PAGE
	EDX = physical address of 4K page
Return: AH = status
	    00h successful
	    nonzero failed
AX.DE06:
Virtual Control Program Interface - GET PHYS ADDR OF PAGE IN FIRST MB
	CX = page number (linear address shifted right 12 bits)
Return: AH = status
	    00h successful
		EDX = physical address of page
	    nonzero invalid page number (AH = 8Bh recommended)
AX.DE07:
Virtual Control Program Interface - READ CR0
Return: AH = 00h
	EBX = value of Control Register 0
AX.DE08:
Virtual Control Program Interface - READ DEBUG REGISTERS
	ES:DI -> array of 8 DWORDs
Return: AH = 00h
	buffer filled with DR0 first, DR7 last, DR4 and DR5 unused
AX.DE09:
Virtual Control Program Interface - SET DEBUG REGISTERS
	ES:DI -> array of 8 DWORDs holding new values of debug registers
Return: AH = 00h
AX.DE0A:
Virtual Control Program Interface - GET 8259 INTERRUPT VECTOR MAPPINGS
Return: AH = 00h successful
	    BX = first vector used by master 8259 (IRQ0)
	    CX = first vector used by slave 8259 (IRQ8)
	AH nonzero: failed
AX.DE0B:
Virtual Control Program Interface - SET 8259 INTERRUPT VECTOR MAPPINGS
	BX = first vector used by master 8259
	CX = first vector used by slave 8259
	interrupts disabled
Return: AH = 00h successful
	AH nonzero: failed
AX.DE0C:
Virtual Control Program Interface - SWITCH TO PROTECTED MODE
	ESI = linear address in first megabyte of values for system
	      registers (see #03665)
	interrupts disabled
Return: interrupts disabled
	GDTR, IDTR, LDTR, TR loaded
	SS:ESP must have at least 16 bytes space, and the entry point is
	      required to set up a new stack before enabling interrupts
	EAX, ESI, DS, ES, FS, GS destroyed

67.name: reserved for user interrupt; LIM EMS; multiple purposes

AX.0000:
Novell NASI/NACS, Ungermann-Bass Net One SERIAL I/O - BUFFERED WRITE
	CX = length
	ES:BX -> buffer
Return: CX = number of bytes written
AX.0100:
Novell NASI/NACS, Ungermann-Bass Net One SERIAL I/O - BUFFERED READ
	CX = length of buffer
	ES:BX -> buffer
Return: CX = number of bytes read
AX.0600:
Novell NASI/NACS, Ungermann-Bass Net One SERIAL I/O - CONTROL
	CX = command
	    02h send break
	    04h disconnect
	    06h hold
Return: CF clear if successful
	    AL = 00h
	CF set on error
	    AX < 0
AX.0700:
Novell NASI/NACS, Ungermann-Bass Net One SERIAL I/O - GET STATUS
Return: CH <> 00h if connection active

AH.02:
Novell NASI/NACS, Ungermann-Bass Net One SERIAL I/O - INSTALL CHECK
	AL nonzero
Return: AL = 00h if present and OK
AH.10:
NPC NCSI EXTENDED SERIAL I/O - GET STATUS
	AL = connection ID (Novell TELAPI.EXE)
	CX = ???
	ES:BX -> buffer for status (see #03730)
Return: CF clear if successful
	    CL = ???
	    CH = ???
	CF set on error
	???
AH.11:
NPC NCSI EXTENDED SERIAL I/O - ALLOCATE A VIRTUAL CIRCUIT
	DX = 0001h
	AL = 00h
	ES:BX -> service name string (8 characters, blank-padded)
Return: CF clear if successful
	    AL = virtual circuit number allocated (01h for Novell TELAPI.EXE)
	    CL = ??? (01h for Novell TELAPI.EXE)
	    CH = ??? (01h for Novell TELAPI.EXE)
	CF set on error
	    ???
AH.12:
NPC NCSI EXTENDED SERIAL I/O - VIRTUAL CIRCUIT STATUS
	AL = virtual circuit number (0-8)
Return: CF clear if successful
	    AL = virtual circuit number
	    CL = virtual circuit's state
		00h idle
		01h Telnet session, in command state
		02h Telnet session, connected to host
		03h-06h ??? (not returned by TelAPI)
	CF set on error
	    AL = error code
		E2h invalid virtual circuit number
		E4h specified virtual circuit not allocated
AH.13:
NPC NCSI EXTENDED SERIAL I/O - SET/RETRIEVE REQUEST/REPLY SERVICE NAME
	AL = virtual circuit number
	CL = direction (00h get, nonzero set)
	ES:BX -> buffer for/containing service name
Return: ???
AH.14:
NPC NCSI EXTENDED SERIAL I/O - SET/RETRIEVE SERVICE ADDRESS
	AL = virtual circuit number
	ES:BX -> buffer for/containing service address
Return: ???
AH.15:
NPC NCSI EXTENDED SERIAL I/O - SET/RETRIEVE VIRTUAL CIRCUIT CONFIG
	AL = virtual circuit number
	CL = direction (00h get, nonzero set)
	ES:BX -> buffer for/containing virtual circuit config (see #03731)
Return: ES:BX buffer filled
AH.16:
NPC NCSI EXTENDED SERIAL I/O - LOG AND/OR INITIALIZE VIRTUAL CIRCUIT
	AL = virtual circuit number
	CL = ??? switch (00h, ???)
Return: CF clear if successful
	    AL = virtual circuit number
	CF set on error
	    ???
AH.17:
NPC NCSI EXTENDED SERIAL I/O - DISCONNECT A VIRTUAL CIRCUIT
	AL = virtual circuit number
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
	???
AH.18:
NPC NCSI EXTENDED SERIAL I/O - WRITE DATA ON A VIRTUAL CIRCUIT
	AL = virtual circuit number
	CX = number of characters to send
	ES:BX -> buffer containing characters to be sent
Return: CF clear if successful
	CF set on error
	???
AH.19:
NPC NCSI EXTENDED SERIAL I/O - READ DATA ON A VIRTUAL CIRCUIT
	AL = virtual circuit number
	CX = number of characters to read
	ES:BX -> buffer for received characters
Return: CX = 0000h if failed
	CX = nonzero (possibly number of characters received) if successful
AH.1A:
NPC NCSI EXTENDED SERIAL I/O - RECEIVE STATUS
	???
Return: ???
AH.1B:
NPC NCSI EXTENDED SERIAL I/O - TRANSMIT STATUS
	???
Return: ???
AH.1C:
NPC NCSI EXTENDED SERIAL I/O - CLEAR RECEIVE BUFFER
	AL = circuit number
Return: nothing
AH.1D:
NPC NCSI EXTENDED SERIAL I/O - TRANSMIT BUFFER CONTROL
	???
Return: ???
AH.1E:
NPC NCSI EXTENDED SERIAL I/O - ISSUE CONTROL REQUEST
	???
Return: ???
AH.1F:
NPC NCSI EXTENDED SERIAL I/O - EXTERNAL STATUS
	???
Return: ???
AH.21:
NPC NCSI EXTENDED SERIAL I/O - QUERY NAME SERVICE
	AL = virtual circuit number
	CL = ??? (00h or 01h)
	ES:BX -> buffer for service name structure (see #03732)
Return: CF clear if successful
	    ES:BX buffer filled
	CF set on error

F0.name: BASICA.COM, GWBASIC, compiled BASIC - ORIGINAL INT 08 VECTOR

AH.01:
TFPCX - TEST FOR CHARACTER WAITING
Return: AX = status
	    0000h no characters waiting
	    0001h character available for input
AH.02:
TFPCX - GET CHARACTER
Return: AL = character
AH.03:
TFPCX - OUTPUT CHARACTER
	AL = character to send
Return: nothing
AH.FE:
TFPCX - GET VERSION
Return: AH = major version
	AL = minor version

FE.name: AT/XT286/PS50+ - destroyed by return from protected mode

BX.0000:
PC/FORTH - GRAPHICS API - VIDEO STATUS CHANGE
	DS:SI -> FORTH program counter
	SS:BP -> FORTH parameter stack
	SS:SP -> FORTH return stack
	DS:DX -> FORTH video parameter area

FF.name: AT/XT286/PS50+ - destroyed by return from protected mode
